  4410                                  
  4411                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4412                                  BPB48T:
  4413                                  ;bpb48t:	; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 112, 720, 0FDh, 2, 9, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4414                                  		; 48 tpi diskettes	;
  4415                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4416                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4417                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4418                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4419                                  		dw	112		; number of directory entries
  4420                                  		dw	720 ; 2*9*40	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4421                                  		db	0FDh		; media descriptor
  4422                                  		dw	2		; number of fat sectors
  4423                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4424                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4425                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4426                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4427                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4428                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)					
  4429                                  
  4430                                  		db 90h
  4431                                  ;align 2
  4432                                  BPB96T:
  4433                                  ;bpb96t:	; bpbx <512, 1, 1, 2, 224, 2400, 0F9h, 7, 15, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4434                                  		; 96 tpi diskettes	;
  4435                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4436                                  		db	1		; sectors/allocation unit
  4437                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4438                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4439                                  		dw	224		; number of directory entries
  4440                                  		dw	2400 ; 2*15*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4441                                  		db	0F9h		; media descriptor
  4442                                  		dw	7		; number of fat sectors
  4443                                  		dw	15		; sectors per track
  4444                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4445                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4446                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4447                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4448                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4449                                  
  4450                                  		db 90h
  4451                                  ;align 2
  4452                                  BPB35:
  4453                                  ;bpb35:		; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 112, 1440, 0F9h, 3, 9, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4454                                  		; 3.5" diskettes - 720 KB ;		
  4455                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4456                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4457                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4458                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4459                                  		dw	112		; number of directory entries
  4460                                  		dw	1440 ; 2*9*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4461                                  		db	0F9h		; media descriptor
  4462                                  		dw	3		; number of fat sectors
  4463                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4464                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4465                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4466                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4467                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4468                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4469                                  
  4470                                  		db 90h
  4471                                  ;align 2
  4472

  4474                                  ;BPB144:

  4476                                  ;

  4478                                  ;		db	1		; sectors/allocation unit
  4479                                  ;		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4480                                  ;		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4481                                  ;		dw	224		; number of directory entries
  4482                                  ;		dw	2880 ; 2*18*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4483                                  ;		db	0F0h		; media descriptor
  4484                                  ;		dw	9		; number of fat sectors
  4485                                  ;		dw	18		; sectors per track
  4486                                  ;		dw	2		; heads
  4487                                  ;		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4488                                  ;		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4489                                  ;		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4490                                  ;		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4491                                  ;

  4494

  4497                                  		; 3.5" diskettes - 2.88 MB ;

  4499                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4500                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4501                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4502                                  		dw	240		; number of directory entries
  4503                                  		dw	5760 ; 2*36*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4504                                  		db	0F0h		; media descriptor
  4505                                  		dw	3		; number of fat sectors

  4509                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)

  4512

  4514                                  ;align 2
  4515                                  
  4516                                  %endif
  4517                                  
  4518                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4519                                  					; align	2
  4520                                  ; 09/12/2022

  4553                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4554                                  
  4555                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  4556                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  4557                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  4558                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  4559                                  ;
  4560                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  4561                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  4562                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  4563                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  4564                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  4565                                  ;	  and a retf
  4566                                  
  4567                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4568                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  4569                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4570                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  4571                                  
  4572                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  4573                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  4574 00001763 [C800]                  		dw BC_RETF
  4575                                  
  4576                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4577                                  
  4578                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  4579 00001765 2EFF36[6317]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  4580                                  					; set up near return to far return
  4581 0000176A 2EFF36[E006]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  4582 0000176F 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  4583 00001770 CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code
  4584                                  
  4585                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4586                                  
  4587 00001771 00                      flp_drvs	db 0

  4590                                  
  4591                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4592                                  
  4593                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4594                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4595                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4596                                  
  4597                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4598                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4599                                  		;=============================================================
  4600                                  		;
  4601                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4602                                  		;
  4603                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4604                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4605                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4606                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4607                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4608                                  
  4609                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4610                                  		;=============================================================
  4611                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4612                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4613                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4614                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4615                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4616                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4617                                  
  4618                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4619                                  		; (from MSLOAD)
  4620                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h, bp = any, ds = previous cs  
  4621                                  		
  4622 00001772 FA                      		cli
  4623                                  
  4624                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4625                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4626                                  		;push	ax
  4627                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4628                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4629                                  		;pop	ax
  4630                                  	
  4631                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4632                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4633                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4634                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4635                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4636                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4637                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4638                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4639                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4640                                  
  4641                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4642                                  
  4643                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4644                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4645                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4646                                  
  4647 00001773 2EA3[CE16]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4648 00001777 2E891E[CC16]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4649                                  
  4650                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4651                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4652                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4653                                  
  4654 0000177C 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4655 0000177D 07                      		pop	es
  4656 0000177E 51                      		push	cx
  4657 0000177F 57                      		push	di
  4658                                  
  4659                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4660                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4661                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4662                                  		; ds = cs
  4663 00001780 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4664 00001782 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4665                                  		; ds = 0
  4666                                  
  4667 00001784 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4668                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4669                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4670                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4671 00001786 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4672                                  next_int_:		
  4673 00001789 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4674 0000178A AC                      		lodsb		
  4675                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4676 0000178B 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4677 0000178C D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4678 0000178E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4679 00001790 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4680 00001792 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4681                                  					; saving address in di
  4682                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4683                                  		;stosw
  4684                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4685                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4686                                  		; 28/09/2023
  4687 00001794 A5                      		movsw
  4688 00001795 A5                      		movsw
  4689                                  
  4690 00001796 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4691 00001798 E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4692 0000179A 5F                      		pop	di
  4693 0000179B 59                      		pop	cx
  4694                                  
  4695                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4696                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4697                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4698                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4699                                  
  4700                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4701                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4702                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4703                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4704                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4705                                  
  4706                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4707 0000179C C7064C00[7407]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4708                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4709                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4710 000017A2 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4711                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4712 000017A6 C7065400[4808]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4713                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4714                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4715 000017AC 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4716                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4717 000017B0 C7066400[F907]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4718                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4719                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4720 000017B6 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4721                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4722                                  
  4723                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4724 000017BA 0E                      		push	cs
  4725 000017BB 1F                      		pop	ds
  4726                                  		
  4727 000017BC A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4728 000017BF A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4729 000017C2 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4730 000017C5 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4731                                  					; ;
  4732 000017C8 FB                      		sti
  4733 000017C9 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4734                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4735                                  
  4736                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4737                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4738                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4739                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4740                                  ;
  4741                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4742                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4743                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4744                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4745                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4746                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4747                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4748                                  
  4749                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4750                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4751                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4752                                  ;
  4753                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4754                                  ; to do anything special.
  4755                                  ;
  4756                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4757                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4758                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4759                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4760                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4761                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4762                                  
  4763                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4764 000017CB A801                    		test	al, 1
  4765                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4766 000017CD 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4767                                  
  4768                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4769                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4770                                  ;
  4771                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4772                                  ;
  4773                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4774                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4775                                  
  4776 000017CF 50                      		push	ax
  4777 000017D0 53                      		push	bx
  4778 000017D1 51                      		push	cx
  4779 000017D2 52                      		push	dx
  4780 000017D3 57                      		push	di
  4781 000017D4 06                      		push	es
  4782 000017D5 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4783 000017D7 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4784 000017D9 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4785                                  					; DL = drive number
  4786                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4787                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4788                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4789 000017DB 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4790                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4791                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4792                                  		; ds = cs
  4793 000017DD 8816[7117]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4794                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4795 000017E1 07                      		pop	es
  4796 000017E2 5F                      		pop	di
  4797 000017E3 5A                      		pop	dx
  4798 000017E4 59                      		pop	cx
  4799 000017E5 5B                      		pop	bx
  4800 000017E6 58                      		pop	ax
  4801 000017E7 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4802                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4803                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4804                                  
  4805                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4806                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4807                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4808                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4809 000017E9 A0[7117]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4810 000017EC 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4811 000017EE 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4812                                  
  4813                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4814                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4815 000017F0 48                      		dec	ax
  4816 000017F1 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4817                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4818                                  
  4819                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4820                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4821 000017F3 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4822 000017F6 A2[E116]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4823                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4824                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4825                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4826 000017F9 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4827                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4828                                  
  4829                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4830 000017FB D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4831 000017FD D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4832                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4833                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4834                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4835 000017FF 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4836 00001801 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4837 00001803 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4838                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4839                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4840                                  		; ds = cs
  4841 00001804 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4842                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4843                                  notsingle:				
  4844 00001808 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4845                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4846                                  					; booted off hard file
  4847 00001809 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4848                                  
  4849                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4850                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4851                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4852                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4853                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4854                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4855                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4856                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4857                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4858                                  
  4859                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4860                                  
  4861 0000180B F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4862 0000180E 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4863 00001810 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4864                                  gothrd:					
  4865                                  		; 07/10/2023			
  4866                                  		;xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4867                                  		;			; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4868                                  		;			; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4869                                  		;			; ch = media byte
  4870                                  
  4871                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4872                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h (from MSLOAD)
  4873                                  		;cli
  4874                                  		;mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4875                                  		;mov	sp, 700h
  4876                                  		;sti
  4877                                  
  4878 00001812 51                      		push	cx ; *		; save number of floppies and media byte
  4879 00001813 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  4880 00001815 50                      		push	ax ; **		; save boot drive number and media byte
  4881                                  		
  4882                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  4883                                  
  4884 00001816 B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  4885 00001818 CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  4886 0000181A 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  4887 0000181C 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  4888 0000181F 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  4889                                  
  4890                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4891                                  		; ds = cs

  5220                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5221                                  ; diskette drives:
  5222                                  ;
  5223                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5224                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5225                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5226                                  ;
  5227                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5228                                  ;
  5229                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5230                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5231                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5232                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  5233

  5243                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5244                                  
  5245                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5246                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5247                                  
  5248                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5249                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5250                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5251                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5252                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5253                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5254                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5255                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  5256                                  
  5257 0000198A 803E[E116]01            		cmp	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1

  5259 00001991 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5260                                  					; di <-	first bds link
  5261 00001993 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5262                                  					; di <-	second bds link
  5263 00001995 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; set end of link
  5264 00001999 E90F01                  		jmp	dohard		; allocate/initialise bds for harddrives

  5278                                  					; set form factor to 48	tpi

  5552                                  ; than two diskette drives

  5555                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5556                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5557                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5558                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk

  5570                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5571                                  
  5572                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5573                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5574                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5575                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5576                                  ;
  5577                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5578                                  ;
  5579                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5580                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5581                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5582                                  ;use to start with.
  5583                                  ;
  5584                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5585                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5586                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5587                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5588                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5589

  5657                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5658                                  
  5659                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5660                                  ;
  5661                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5662                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5663                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5664                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5665                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5666                                  ; off of it.
  5667                                  ;
  5668                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5669                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5670                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5671                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5672                                  ; when to install the hook.
  5673                                  
  5674                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  5675                                  ; 02/10/2022				
  5676                                  checkcompaqbug:
  5677                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5678                                  		; es = 0F000h
  5679                                  		;mov	ax, 0F000h	; point	to ROM BIOS
  5680                                  		;mov	es, ax
  5681                                  
  5682                                  		; 19/10/2022
  5683 00001B50 26813EEAFF434F          		cmp	word [es:0FFEAh], 'CO'
  5684                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEAh, 'OC' ; look for COMPAQ
  5685 00001B57 754B                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5686 00001B59 26813EECFF4D50          		cmp	word [es:0FFECh], 'MP'
  5687                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFECh, 'PM'
  5688 00001B60 7542                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5689 00001B62 26813EEEFF4151          		cmp	word [es:0FFEEh], 'AQ'
  5690                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEEh, 'QA'
  5691 00001B69 7539                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5692                                  
  5693                                  ; We're running on a COMPAQ. Now look at the date code.
  5694                                  
  5695 00001B6B 26A1FBFF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFFBh]	; get year
  5696 00001B6F 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al

  5956                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5957                                  ;
  5958                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5959                                  
  5960                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5961                                  
  5962                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5963                                  ; module name: remap
  5964                                  ;
  5965                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5966                                  ;
  5967                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5968                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5969                                  ;
  5970                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5971                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5972                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5973                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5974                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5975                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5976                                  
  5977                                  ; input:       none
  5978                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5979                                  ; exit error:  none
  5980                                  ; called from: msinit
  5981                                  ;
  5982                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5983                                  ;	  found in the system
  5984                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5985                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5986                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5987                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5988                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5989                                  ;
  5990                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5991                                  
  5992                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5993                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5994                                  
  5995                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5996 00001C66 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5997                                  
  5998                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5999                                  
  6000                                  drive_loop:				
  6001 00001C6B 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6002                                  					; first	hard disk??
  6003 00001C6F 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  6004 00001C71 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6005                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  6006 00001C73 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  6007 00001C76 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  6008 00001C78 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  6009                                  
  6010                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6011                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  6012                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  6013                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6014                                  
  6015                                  fdrv_found:				
  6016 00001C7A B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  6017                                  fdrv_loop:				
  6018 00001C7C 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6019                                  					; found	??
  6020 00001C7F 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6021                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6022                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6023                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6024 00001C81 40                      		inc	ax
  6025 00001C82 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  6026 00001C85 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  6027                                  
  6028                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6029                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6030                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6031                                  ; any more.
  6032                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6033                                  
  6034 00001C87 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6035                                  					; get first bds
  6036 00001C8C 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6037                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6038 00001C8E 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6039 00001C93 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6040                                  remap_loop1:				
  6041 00001C96 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6042                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6043 00001C98 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6044 00001C9B FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6045 00001C9D FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  6046 00001C9F 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6047                                  
  6048                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6049                                  
  6050 00001CA1 2EA0[CA16]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6051 00001CA5 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6052 00001CA7 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6053 00001CA9 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  6054 00001CAE 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6055                                  
  6056                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6057                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6058                                  
  6059 00001CB0 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6060 00001CB2 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6061                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6062                                  
  6063                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6064                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6065                                  
  6066                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  6067 00001CB4 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6068                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6069 00001CB9 2EA2[CA16]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6070 00001CBD FEC0                    		inc	al
  6071 00001CBF 1E                      		push	ds
  6072 00001CC0 BF4F04                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6073                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6074 00001CC3 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6075 00001CC5 A2[9602]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6076                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6077                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6078 00001CC8 1F                      		pop	ds
  6079                                  rmap_exit:				
  6080 00001CC9 C3                      		retn
  6081

  6088                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6089                                  ;**************************************************
  6090                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6091                                  ;
  6092                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6093                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6094                                  ;
  6095                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6096                                  ;**************************************************
  6097                                  
  6098                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6099                                  bootbias equ 200h
  6100                                  
  6101                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  6102                                  		
  6103                                  		; 08/04/2018
  6104                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  6105                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6106                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6107                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6108                                  
  6109 00001CCA 2EA1[D516]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6110 00001CCE 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6111                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6112 00001CD0 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6113                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6114                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6115 00001CD3 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6116 00001CD6 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6117 00001CD8 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6118 00001CDB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6119                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6120                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6121                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6122 00001CDD 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6123                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6124 00001CDF 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6125                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6126                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6127 00001CE6 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6128                                  erret:					
  6129 00001CE8 F9                      		stc
  6130                                  norm_ret:				
  6131 00001CE9 C3                      		retn
  6132                                  
  6133                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6134                                  
  6135                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6136                                  
  6137                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6138                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6139                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6140                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6141                                  ;   determine version number
  6142                                  ;
  6143                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6144                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6145                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6146                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6147                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6148                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6149                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6150                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6151                                  
  6152                                  sethard:	; proc near		
  6153                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6154                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6155 00001CEA 57                      		push	di
  6156 00001CEB 53                      		push	bx
  6157                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 14/08/2023
  6158 00001CEC 06                      		push	es
  6159 00001CED 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6160 00001CF0 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6161 00001CF3 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6162                                  					; fnon_removable
  6163 00001CF7 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6164                                  					; ffHardFile
  6165 00001CFB C606[D216]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6166 00001D00 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6167 00001D02 52                      		push	dx
  6168 00001D03 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6169 00001D05 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6170                                  					; DL = drive number
  6171                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6172                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6173                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6174 00001D07 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  6175 00001D09 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6176 00001D0C 5A                      		pop	dx
  6177 00001D0D 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6178 00001D0F 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6179 00001D12 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6180 00001D15 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6181 00001D16 E8B1FF                  		call	getboot
  6182 00001D19 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6183 00001D1A 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6184 00001D1C BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6185                                  
  6186                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6187                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6188                                  
  6189                                  act_part:				
  6190 00001D1F 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6191 00001D24 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6192 00001D26 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6193 00001D2A 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6194 00001D2C 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6195 00001D30 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6196 00001D32 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6197 00001D36 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6198                                  got_good_act:				
  6199 00001D38 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6200 00001D3A 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6201 00001D3C FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6202                                  no_act:					
  6203 00001D3E 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6204 00001D41 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6205                                  					; last entry done?
  6206 00001D45 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6207 00001D47 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6208                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6209                                  
  6210                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6211                                  
  6212                                  get_primary:				
  6213 00001D4A 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6214 00001D4F 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6215                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6216 00001D51 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6217 00001D55 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6218 00001D57 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6219 00001D5B 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6220 00001D5D 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6221 00001D61 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6222                                  got_prim:				
  6223 00001D63 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6224 00001D65 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6225 00001D67 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6226                                  not_prim:				
  6227 00001D69 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6228 00001D6C 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6229 00001D70 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6230                                  setret:					
  6231 00001D72 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6232 00001D73 E9A002                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6233                                  
  6234                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6235                                  
  6236                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6237                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6238                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6239                                  ;
  6240                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6241                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6242                                  ;  without change.
  6243                                  ;
  6244                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6245                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6246                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6247                                  
  6248                                  set2:					
  6249                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6250                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6251 00001D76 8816[D716]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  6252                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6253                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6254 00001D7A 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6255 00001D7E 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6256                                  
  6257                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6258                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6259                                  
  6260 00001D82 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6261 00001D85 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6262 00001D88 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6263 00001D8C 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6264 00001D90 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6265 00001D92 800E[D216]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6266                                  okdrive:				
  6267 00001D97 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6268 00001D9B 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6269                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6270 00001D9E 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6271 00001DA2 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6272 00001DA5 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6273 00001DA9 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6274 00001DAD 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6275 00001DB0 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6276                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  6277 00001DB3 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  6278 00001DB6 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  6279 00001DB8 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6280 00001DBB 72B5                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6281                                  okdrive_1:				
  6282 00001DBD 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6283 00001DC0 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6284 00001DC3 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6285                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6286 00001DC5 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6287 00001DC8 50                      		push	ax
  6288 00001DC9 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6289 00001DCB 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6290 00001DCD F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6291                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6292                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6293                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6294                                  		; 14/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6295 00001DCF A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  6296 00001DD2 58                      		pop	ax
  6297 00001DD3 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6298 00001DD5 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6299 00001DD7 FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6300 00001DD9 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6301 00001DDB 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6302 00001DDE 50                      		push	ax
  6303 00001DDF 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6304                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  6305 00001DE1 A1[2905]                		mov	ax, [temp_h] ; 14/08/2023
  6306 00001DE4 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6307                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6308 00001DE6 A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax ; 14/08/2023
  6309 00001DE9 58                      		pop	ax
  6310 00001DEA F7F3                    		div	bx		; dl is head, ax is cylinder
  6311                                  		; 14/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6312 00001DEC 833E[2905]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
  6313                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6314 00001DF1 775F                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6315 00001DF3 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6316 00001DF6 775A                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6317                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6318                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6319                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6320                                  okdrive_2:
  6321                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6322                                  ; dl is head.
  6323                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6324                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6325                                  
  6326                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6327                                  
  6328 00001DF8 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  6329                                  					; check	for mini disk
  6330 00001DFC 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  6331 00001DFE 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6332                                  					; set the physical track number
  6333                                  oknotmini:
  6334                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6335                                  				
  6336 00001E01 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two	bits of	cyl to high
  6337 00001E03 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6338 00001E05 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of	bits
  6339 00001E08 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits	to correct spot
  6340 00001E0A 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch is	cylinder (low 8	bits)
  6341                                  					; cl is	sector + 2 high	bits of	cylinder
  6342 00001E0C 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  6343                                  		
  6344                                  		; 14/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6345 00001E0E 8A16[D716]              		mov	dl, [rom_drv_num]
  6346                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6347                                  
  6348                                  
  6349                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6350                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6351                                  ; dh is head
  6352                                  ; dl is drive
  6353                                  
  6354                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6355                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6356                                  
  6357                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6358                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  6359                                  
  6360 00001E12 0E                      		push	cs
  6361 00001E13 07                      		pop	es
  6362 00001E14 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6363                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot	sector
  6364                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6365 00001E17 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6366 00001E1A CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6367                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6368                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6369                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6370                                  
  6371                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6372                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6373                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6374                                  
  6375                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6376                                  		;mov	bx, disksector	; BIOSDATA:014Eh ; MSDOS 6.21 ; 11/08/2023
  6377                                  					; BIOSDATA:0152h ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6378 00001E1C 53                      		push	bx
  6379 00001E1D 50                      		push	ax
  6380                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6381                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment ('disksector:' is in BIOSDATA) 
  6382 00001E1E 803FE9                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E9h
  6383                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6384 00001E21 740B                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6385 00001E23 803FEB                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0EBh
  6386                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6387 00001E26 7525                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6388 00001E28 807F0290                		cmp	byte [bx+2], 90h
  6389                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6390 00001E2C 751F                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid bs ; 11/08/2023
  6391                                  check_1_ok:	
  6392                                  		; 14/08/2023			
  6393 00001E2E BB[5901]                		mov	bx, disksector+11 ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6394                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6395                                  					; point	to the bpb in the boot record
  6396                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6397 00001E31 8A470A                  		mov	al, [bx+10] ; 14/08/2023 
  6398                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6399 00001E34 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6400 00001E36 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6401 00001E38 7513                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no,	invalid	boot record
  6402                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6403 00001E3A 813F0002                		cmp	word [bx], 512 ; 14/08/2023
  6404 00001E3E 750D                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6405                                  
  6406                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6407 00001E40 8A4702                  		mov	al, [bx+2] ; 14/08/2023
  6408                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure that
  6409                                  					; the sectorspercluster	is
  6410                                  					; a power of 2
  6411                                  					;
  6412                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6413                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6414 00001E43 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it	zero?
  6415 00001E45 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  6416                                  
  6417                                  ck_power_of_two:			
  6418 00001E47 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift	until first bit	emerges
  6419 00001E49 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  6420 00001E4B 740B                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  6421                                  
  6422                                  invalid_boot_record:			
  6423 00001E4D 58                      		pop	ax
  6424 00001E4E 5B                      		pop	bx
  6425 00001E4F E90F01                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  6426                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  6427                                  	; 14/08/2023	
  6428                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6429                                  setret_brdg:				
  6430 00001E52 E91DFF                  		jmp	setret
  6431                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6432                                  
  6433                                  unknown3_0_j:				
  6434 00001E55 E90D01                  		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6435                                  					; although, content might be bad.
  6436                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6437                                  
  6438                                  valid_boot_record:			
  6439 00001E58 58                      		pop	ax
  6440 00001E59 5B                      		pop	bx
  6441                                  
  6442                                  ; Signature found. Now check version.
  6443                                  
  6444                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6445 00001E5A 817F08322E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '2.'
  6446                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '2.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6447                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E32h ; '2.'
  6448 00001E5F 7506                    		jnz	short try5
  6449 00001E61 807F0A30                		cmp	byte [bx+10], '0'
  6450                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+0Ah], '0' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6451                                  		;;cmp	byte ptr cs:[bx+0Ah], 30h ; '0'
  6452                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6453                                  		;jnz	short try5
  6454                                  		;jmp	short copybpb
  6455 00001E65 7425                    		jz	short copybpb
  6456                                  
  6457                                  	; 14/08/2023
  6458                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6459                                  ;
  6460                                  ;setret_brdg:				
  6461                                  ;		jmp	setret
  6462                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6463                                  ;
  6464                                  ;unknown3_0_j:				
  6465                                  ;		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6466                                  ;					; although, content might be bad.
  6467                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6468                                  
  6469                                  try5:					
  6470 00001E67 E8B001                  		call	cover_fdisk_bug
  6471                                  
  6472                                  ; see if it is an os2 signature
  6473                                  
  6474                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6475                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment
  6476 00001E6A 817F08302E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '0.'
  6477                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '0.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6478                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E30h ; '0.'

  6881                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6882                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  6883                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!

  6909 00001FC4 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx

  6912 00001FCA 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1

  6918                                  
  6919                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  6920                                  
  6921                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  6922                                  		; 27/09/2022
  6923                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  6924                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  6925                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  6926                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  6927                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  6928                                  		; (If FATType == FAT16,	BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz))
  6929                                  		
  6930                                  					; dx:ax = TmpVal1, bx = TmpVal2
  6931 00001FD5 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; 
  6932 00001FD7 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2
  6933 00001FDA 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		
  6934 00001FDD 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2-1
  6935                                  
  6936                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.

  6939                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))

  7108                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors
  7109                                  ; are present in the bpbtable. for hard files, the recommended bpb is the same
