  9083                                  auxop:		; proc near		
  9084 0000035C 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; ah=function code
  9085                                  					; 0=init, 1=send, 2=receive, 3=status
  9086                                  					; get port number
  9087 00000360 CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - GET USART STATUS
  9088                                  					; DX = port number (0-3)
  9089                                  					; Return: AX = port status code
  9090 00000362 C3                      		retn
  9091                                  
  9092                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9093                                  
  9094                                  ;************************************************************************
  9095                                  ;*									*
  9096                                  ;*	aux_flsh - flush aux input buffer - set contents of		*
  9097                                  ;*		   auxbuf [auxnum] to zero				*
  9098                                  ;*									*
  9099                                  ;*	cas - shouldn't this code call the rom bios input function	*
  9100                                  ;*	      repeatedly until it isn't ready?  to flush out any	*
  9101                                  ;*	      pending serial input queue if there's a tsr like MODE	*
  9102                                  ;*	      which is providing interrupt-buffering of aux port?	*
  9103                                  ;*									*
  9104                                  ;************************************************************************
  9105                                  
  9106                                  aux_flsh:				; 2C7h:36Ch = 70h:28DCh
  9107 00000363 E81C00                  		call	getbx		; flush	aux input buffer
  9108 00000366 C60700                  		mov	byte [bx], 0	; get bx to point to auxbuf
  9109                                  					; zero out buffer
  9110                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  9111                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9112                                  		; cf=0 ('add' instruction in 'getbx')
  9113 00000369 C3                      		retn
  9114                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9115                                  
  9116                                  ;************************************************************************
  9117                                  ;*									*
  9118                                  ;*	aux_writ - write to aux device					*
  9119                                  ;*									*
  9120                                  ;************************************************************************
  9121                                  
  9122                                  aux_writ:				; 2C7h:374h = 70h:28E4h
  9123                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2	; write	to aux device (if cx > 0)
  9124 0000036A E3AD                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  9125                                  aux_loop:				
  9126 0000036C 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to be written
  9127                                  					; move di pointer to next character
  9128 0000036F 47                      		inc	di
  9129 00000370 B401                    		mov	ah, 1		; auxfunc_send - indicates a write
  9130 00000372 E8E7FF                  		call	auxop		; send character over aux port
  9131 00000375 F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; check	for error
  9132 00000378 7405                    		jz	short awok	; then no error
  9133 0000037A B00A                    		mov	al, 10		; else indicate	write fault
  9134 0000037C E958FD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt	; call error routines
  9135                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9136                                  
  9137                                  awok:					
  9138 0000037F E2EB                    		loop	aux_loop	; if cx	is non-zero,
  9139                                  					; still	more character to print
  9140                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  9141                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9142                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction above)	
  9143 00000381 C3                      		retn
  9144                                  
  9145                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9146                                  
  9147                                  ;************************************************************************
  9148                                  ;*									*
  9149                                  ;*	getbx - return bx -> single byte input buffer for		*
  9150                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
  9151                                  ;*									*
  9152                                  ;************************************************************************
  9153                                  
  9154                                  getbx:	
  9155 00000382 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
  9156                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
  9157                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  9158 00000386 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  9159                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9160                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  9161 0000038A C3                      		retn
  9162                                  
  9163                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9164                                  
  9165                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9166                                  
  9167                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9168                                  ;								:
  9169                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  9170                                  ;								:
  9171                                  ;								:
  9172                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  9173                                  ;								:
  9174                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  9175                                  ;								:
  9176                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  9177                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  9178                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  9179                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  9180                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  9181                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  9182                                  ;								:
  9183                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  9184                                  ;								:
  9185                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  9186                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  9187                                  ;								:
  9188                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9189                                  
  9190                                  ; convert time to ticks
  9191                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  9192                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  9193                                  
  9194                                  ;19/07/2019
  9195                                  ;09/03/2019
  9196                                  
  9197                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  9198                                  
  9199                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  9200                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  9201                                  
  9202 0000038B B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  9203 0000038D F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  9204 0000038F B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9205 00000391 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  9206 00000393 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  9207 00000396 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  9208 00000398 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  9209 0000039A 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  9210 0000039C B064                    		mov	al, 100
  9211 0000039E F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  9212 000003A0 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  9213 000003A2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  9214 000003A5 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  9215 000003A7 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  9216 000003A9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9217                                  
  9218                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  9219                                  
  9220 000003AC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9221 000003AD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  9222 000003AE BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  9223 000003B1 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  9224 000003B3 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  9225 000003B5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  9226 000003B6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  9227 000003B8 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  9228 000003BA 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9229 000003BD 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  9230 000003BE BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  9231 000003C1 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  9232 000003C3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  9233 000003C5 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9234 000003C7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  9235 000003C9 98                      		cbw
  9236 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  9237 000003CB F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  9238 000003CD 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  9239 000003CF CB                      		retf			; far return
  9240                                  
  9241                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9242                                  
  9243                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9244                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9245                                  
  9246                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9247                                  ;
  9248                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  9249                                  ;
  9250                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  9251                                  ;
  9252                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  9253                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  9254                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  9255                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  9256                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  9257                                  ;
  9258                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  9259                                  ;
  9260                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9261                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9262                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9263                                  ;
  9264                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9265                                  
  9266                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  9267 000003D0 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  9268 000003D3 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  9269                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  9270 000003D4 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9271                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9272 000003D9 7426                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  9273 000003DB 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  9274                                  					; get binary hours
  9275                                  					; convert to bcd
  9276 000003DF FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9277                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  9278 000003E3 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  9279 000003E5 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  9280 000003E9 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9281                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  9282 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  9283 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  9284 000003F3 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9285                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd
  9286 000003F7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  9287 000003F9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  9288 000003FB FA                      		cli
  9289 000003FC B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  9290 000003FE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9291                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  9292                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9293                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9294 00000400 FB                      		sti
  9295                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9296 00000401 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9297 00000405 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9298                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9299 00000409 FF1E[E206]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9300                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9301                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9302                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9303 0000040D FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9304 0000040E B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9305 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9306                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9307                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9308                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9309 00000412 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9310 00000416 FB                      		sti
  9311                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9312 00000417 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9313 0000041C 740A                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9314 0000041E FF1E[0605]              		call	far [daycnttoday]
  9315                                  		;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  9316                                  					; convert to bcd format
  9317 00000422 FA                      		cli
  9318 00000423 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9319 00000425 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9320                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9321                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9322                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9323 00000427 FB                      		sti
  9324                                  no_cmos_2:
  9325                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9326                                  		; cf=0				
  9327                                  		;clc
  9328 00000428 C3                      		retn
  9329                                  
  9330                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9331                                  
  9332                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9333                                  
  9334                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9335                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9336                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9337                                  ;
  9338                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9339                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9340                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9341                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9342                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9343                                  ;
  9344                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9345                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9346                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9347                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9348                                  
  9349                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9350 00000429 E84E00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9351 0000042C 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9352                                  
  9353                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9354                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9355                                  ;
  9356                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9357                                  ;	       ----------------
  9358                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9359                                  ;
  9360                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9361                                  ;
  9362                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9363                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9364                                  ;		1,193,180
  9365                                  ;
  9366                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9367                                  ;
  9368                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9369                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9370                                  ;		59,659
  9371                                  ;
  9372                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9373                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9374                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9375                                  ;
  9376                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9377                                  ; multiply by 5
  9378                                  
  9379 00000430 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9380 00000432 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9381                                  					; multiply by 5
  9382 00000434 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9383 00000436 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9384 00000438 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9385 0000043A D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9386 0000043C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9387 0000043E 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9388 00000440 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9389                                  
  9390                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9391                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9392                                  
  9393 00000441 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9394 00000444 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9395                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9396 00000446 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9397 00000448 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9398 0000044A F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9399                                  
  9400                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9401                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9402                                  
  9403 0000044C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9404 0000044E B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		;extract 1/100's
  9405                                  
  9406                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9407                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9408                                  
  9409 00000451 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9410 00000453 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9411 00000456 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9412 00000458 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9413                                  noadj:					
  9414 0000045B F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9415 0000045C 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9416                                  
  9417                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9418                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9419                                  
  9420 0000045E D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9421 00000460 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9422 00000462 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9423 00000464 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9424 00000467 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9425 00000469 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9426 0000046B F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9427 0000046D 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9428                                  
  9429                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9430                                  
  9431 0000046F 50                      		push	ax
  9432 00000470 89F0                    		mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9433 00000472 AB                      		stosw
  9434 00000473 58                      		pop	ax
  9435 00000474 AB                      		stosw
  9436 00000475 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9437 00000477 AB                      		stosw
  9438 00000478 F8                      		clc
  9439 00000479 C3                      		retn
  9440                                  
  9441                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9442                                  
  9443                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9444                                  
  9445                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9446                                  ;
  9447                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9448                                  ;
  9449                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9450                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9451                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9452                                  ;
  9453                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9454                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9455                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9456                                  ;			else
  9457                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9458                                  ;		}
  9459                                  ;
  9460                                  ; USES : AX
  9461                                  ;
  9462                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9463                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9464                                  ;
  9465                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9466                                  
  9467                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9468                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9469 0000047A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9470 0000047C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9471                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9472                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9473                                  					; midnight
  9474                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9475 0000047E 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9476 00000483 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9477 00000485 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9478                                  					; and not flag
  9479 00000487 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9480 0000048B C3                      		retn
  9481                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9482                                  
  9483                                  inc_case:				
  9484 0000048C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9485 0000048E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9486 00000490 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9487                                  no_rollover:				
  9488 00000494 C3                      		retn
  9489                                  
  9490                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  9492                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  9494                                  ; 09/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9495                                  
  9496                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 3.3 - 02/02/1988
  9497                                  ; 26/05/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9498                                  ; 23/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
  9499

  9501                                  
  9502                                  ;struc BPB_TYPE

  9517                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9518                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9519                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9520                                  
  9521                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9522                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9523                                  
  9524                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9525                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9526                                  
  9527                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9528                                  
  9529                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9530                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9531                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9532                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9533                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9534                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9535                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9536                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9537                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9538                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9539                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9540                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9541                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9542                                  
  9543                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9544                                  
  9545                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9546                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9547                                  ;
  9548                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9549                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9550                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9551                                  ;   else
  9552                                  ;	set slow = value
  9553                                  ;   ...
  9554                                  ;*********************************************
  9555                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9556                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9557                                  ;*	 use slow
  9558                                  ;*   else
  9559                                  ;*	 use fast
  9560                                  ;*********************************************
  9561                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9562                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9563                                  ;	use slow
  9564                                  ;   else
  9565                                  ;	use fast
  9566                                  ;   ...
  9567                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9568                                  ;
  9569                                  ;
  9570                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9571                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9572                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9573                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9574                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9575                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9576                                  
  9577                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9578                                  
  9579                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9580                                  
  9581                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9582

  9584                                  ;	command jump table
  9585                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9586                                  
  9587 00000495 00                      		db 0
  9588

  9590                                  %if 0

  9601                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9605                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9606                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  9607                                  		dw 80Ah			; dsk_open
  9608                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close
  9609                                  		dw 831h			; dsk_rem
  9610                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9611                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9612                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9613                                  		dw 0C6Bh		; do_generic_ioctl
  9614                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9615                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9616                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9643 000004B9 [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9644 000004BB [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear

  9647 000004C1 [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9648 000004C3 [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear

  9652

  9654                                  
  9655                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9656                                  
  9657                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9658                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9659                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9660                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9661                                  ;
  9662                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9663                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9664                                  
  9665                                  SetDrive:	
  9666                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  9667 000004CB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
  9668                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
  9669 000004CF 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
  9670 000004D3 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
  9671 000004D5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
  9672 000004D8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
  9673 000004DB 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
  9674 000004DD F9                      		stc
  9675                                  X_SetDrv:				
  9676 000004DE C3                      		retn
  9677                                  
  9678                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9679                                  
  9680                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9681                                  
  9682                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9683                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9684                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9685                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9686                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9687                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9688                                  
  9689                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
  9690 000004DF E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
  9691 000004E2 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
  9692 000004E5 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
  9693                                  					; fchanged_by_format
  9694 000004EA 7416                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
  9695                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9696 000004EC 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
  9697                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9698                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
  9699 000004F1 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9700                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
  9701 000004F6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9702                                  					; fnon_removable
  9703 000004FB 740C                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
  9704 000004FD BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
  9705 00000500 EB2C                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
  9706                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9707                                  
  9708                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
  9709                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
  9710 00000502 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9711 00000507 7525                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9712                                  wehaveafloppy:				
  9713 00000509 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; Presume "I don't know"
  9714                                  
  9715                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9716                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9717                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
  9718                                  
  9719 0000050B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
  9720 00000510 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
  9721 00000512 E87912                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
  9722 00000515 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
  9723 00000517 E8C913                  		call	haschange
  9724 0000051A 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9725                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
  9726                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
  9727                                  			
  9728 0000051C BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
  9729 0000051F A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
  9730 00000522 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
  9731                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
  9732 00000526 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
  9733 00000528 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
  9734 0000052B EB01                    		jmp	short Media_Done
  9735                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9736                                  
  9737                                  Media_Unk:				
  9738 0000052D 4E                      		dec	si		; ; Return "I don't know"
  9739                                  
  9740                                  		; SI now contains the correct value for media change.
  9741                                  		; Clean up the left overs
  9742                                  Media_Done:	
  9743                                  		; 19/10/2022			
  9744 0000052E 06                      		push	es
  9745 0000052F C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  9746 00000533 2689770E                		mov	[es:bx+0Eh], si	; [es:bx+trans]
  9747 00000537 07                      		pop	es
  9748 00000538 09F6                    		or	si, si
  9749 0000053A 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
  9750 0000053C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
  9751 00000541 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
  9752 00000543 E82F13                  		call	media_set_vid
  9753                                  mChk1_NoChangeLine:			
  9754 00000546 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9755                                  					; Make sure we ask rom for media check
  9756                                  ret_carry_clear:			
  9757 0000054B F8                      		clc			; volidok
  9758 0000054C C3                      		retn
  9759                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9760                                  
  9761                                  err_exitj:				
  9762 0000054D E87D06                  		call	maperror	; guaranteed to	set carry
  9763                                  ret81:					
  9764 00000550 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; return error status
  9765 00000552 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
  9766                                  
  9767                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9768                                  
  9769                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9770                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9771                                  ; drive.
  9772                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9773                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9774                                  ; returns in si:
  9775                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9776                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9777                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9778                                  ;
  9779                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9780                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9781                                  
  9782                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9783                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9784 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9785 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9786 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9787                                  					; get stored time
  9788 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9789 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9790 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9791 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9792 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9793 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9794 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9795 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9796                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9797 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9798 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9799 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9800                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9801                                  
  9802                                  timepassed:				
  9803 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9804                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9805 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9806                                  
  9807                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9808                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9809 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9810                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9811 00000582 C3                      		retn
  9812                                  
  9813                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9814                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9815                                  Err_Exitj2:
  9816 00000583 EBC8                    		jmp	short err_exitj
  9817                                  
  9818                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9819                                  
  9820                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9821                                  
  9822                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9823                                  ; Build a valid bpb for the disk in the drive.
  9824                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9825                                  
  9826                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9827                                  get_bpb:				; 2C7h:592h = 70h:2B02h
  9828 00000585 268A25                  		mov	ah, [es:di]	; get fat id byte read by dos

  9973                                  
  9974                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9975                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9976                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9977                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9978                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9979                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9980                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9981                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9982                                  ;
  9983                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9984                                  ;
  9985                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9986                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9987                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9988                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9989                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9990                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9991                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9992                                  ;
  9993                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9994                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9995                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9996                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9997

 10163                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10164                                  
 10165                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10166                                  
 10167                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10168                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10169                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10170                                  ;
 10171                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10172                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10173                                  
 10174                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10175                                  
 10176                                  readbootsec:	
 10177 000006B1 B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10178 000006B3 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10179 000006B6 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10180 000006B9 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10181 000006BB 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10182                                  
 10183                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10184                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10185                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10186                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10187                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10188                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10189                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10190                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10191                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10192                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10193                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10194                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10195                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10196                                  		; informations
 10197                                  
 10198                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10199                                  
 10200                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10201                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10202                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10203                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10204                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10205                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10206                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10207                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10208                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10209                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10210                                  
 10211                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10212 000006BD A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10213 000006C0 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10214 000006C2 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10215                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10216 000006C4 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10217 000006C6 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10218                                  					; no need for nop
 10219 000006C8 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10220 000006CA 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10221 000006CC 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10222 000006D1 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10223                                  
 10224                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10225                                  ;
 10226                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10227                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10228                                  ;;
 10229                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10230                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10231                                  ;;
 10232                                  ;;check_signature:
 10233                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10234                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10235                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if single sided medium.
 10236                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10237                                  
 10238                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10239                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10240                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10241                                  
 10242                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10243                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
 10244 000006D3 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10245                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10246 000006D6 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10247 000006D7 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10248 000006D9 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10249 000006DB 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10250 000006DC 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10251                                  
 10252                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10253                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10254                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10255                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10256                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10257                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10258                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10259                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10260                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10261                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10262                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10263                                  
 10264                                  checksinglesided:
 10265                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10266                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10267                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10268 000006DE 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10269 000006E0 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10270 000006E2 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10271 000006E4 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10272 000006E6 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10273 000006EC 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10274 000006EE 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10275 000006F3 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10276                                  
 10277                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10278                                  
 10279                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10280 000006F5 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10281                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10282 000006FA EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10283                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10284                                  
 10285                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10286 000006FC 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10287                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10288                                  movbpb_ret:
 10289                                  gooddsk:				
 10290 000006FD F8                      		clc
 10291                                  err_ret:
 10292 000006FE C3                      		retn
 10293                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10294                                  
 10295                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10296                                  ;err_ret:				
 10297                                  		;retn
 10298                                  
 10299                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10300                                  
 10301                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10302                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10303                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10304                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10305                                  ;
 10306                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10307                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10308                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10309                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10310                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10311                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10312                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10313                                  
 10314                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10315                                  
 10316                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10317                                  movbpb:	
 10318 000006FF 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10319                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10320                                  					; sectors per unit
 10321 00000703 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10322                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10323                                  					; number of directory entries
 10324 00000707 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10325                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10326                                  					; size of drive
 10327 0000070B 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10328                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10329                                  					; media	descriptor
 10330 0000070F A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10331                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10332                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10333 00000712 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10334                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10335                                  					; sectors per track
 10336 00000716 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10337                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10338                                  					; number of heads
 10339 0000071A 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10340 0000071F 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10341 00000721 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10342 00000724 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10343 00000726 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10344                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10345 0000072B 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10346 00000730 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10347 00000732 E8A811                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10348                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10349                                  		; cf = 0
 10350                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10351                                  		;clc
 10352 00000735 C3                      		retn
 10353                                  
 10354                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10355                                  
 10356                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10357                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10358                                  ;by es:di.
 10359                                  
 10360                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10361                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10362                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10363                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10364                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10365                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10366                                  
 10367                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10368                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10369 00000736 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10370                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10371                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10372 0000073B 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10373 0000073D 51                      		push	cx
 10374 0000073E 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10375                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 10376 00000742 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10377 00000746 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 10378                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10379 0000074A 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10380 0000074E 57                      		push	di
 10381 0000074F 56                      		push	si
 10382 00000750 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10383 00000753 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10384                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10385                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10386 00000756 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10387 00000759 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10388                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10389                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10390 0000075B B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10391 0000075D BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
 10392                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 10393 00000760 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10394 00000763 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10395 00000765 5E                      		pop	si
 10396 00000766 5F                      		pop	di
 10397 00000767 59                      		pop	cx
 10398                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10399                                  		; cf = 0
 10400                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 10401                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 10402 00000768 C3                      		retn
 10403                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10404                                  
 10405                                  mmi_not_ext:				
 10406 00000769 F9                      		stc
 10407 0000076A C3                      		retn

 10409                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10410                                  
 10411                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10412                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10413                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10414                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10415                                  ; output:
 10416                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10417                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10418                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10419                                  
 10420                                  readfat:	
 10421                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10422                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10423 0000076B 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10424 0000076D B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10425                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10426 00000770 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10427 00000773 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10428 00000775 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10429                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10430 00000777 C3                      		retn
 10431                                  
 10432                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10433                                  
 10434                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10435                                  
 10436                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10437                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10438                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10439                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10440                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10441                                  ;		dh has head
 10442                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10443                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10444                                  ;
 10445                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10446                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10447                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10448                                  ;
 10449                                  ;		carry set
 10450                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10451                                  ;
 10452                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10453                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10454                                  
 10455                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10456                                  
 10457                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10458                                  read_sector:	
 10459 00000778 55                      		push	bp
 10460 00000779 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10461 0000077C 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10462 00000780 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10463                                  rd_ret:					
 10464 00000783 06                      		push	es
 10465 00000784 1E                      		push	ds
 10466 00000785 07                      		pop	es
 10467 00000786 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10468 00000789 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10469                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10470                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10471                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10472 0000078B 07                      		pop	es
 10473 0000078C 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10474                                  rd_rty:					
 10475 0000078E E87404                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10476 00000791 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10477 00000793 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10478                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10479                                  					; fnon_removable
 10480 00000798 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10481 0000079A 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10482 0000079F 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10483 000007A1 50                      		push	ax
 10484 000007A2 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10485 000007A3 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10486                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10487                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10488                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10489                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10490 000007A7 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10491 000007A9 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10492                                  		; 
 10493 000007AC 1F                      		pop	ds
 10494 000007AD A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10495 000007B0 58                      		pop	ax
 10496                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10497 000007B1 06                      		push	es
 10498 000007B2 1E                      		push	ds
 10499 000007B3 07                      		pop	es
 10500 000007B4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10501 000007B7 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10502                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10503                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10504                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10505 000007B9 07                      		pop	es
 10506 000007BA 9C                      		pushf
 10507 000007BB 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10508 000007C0 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10509 000007C2 50                      		push	ax
 10510 000007C3 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10511 000007C6 1E                      		push	ds
 10512 000007C7 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10513 000007CB 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10514 000007CE 1F                      		pop	ds
 10515 000007CF 58                      		pop	ax
 10516                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10517 000007D0 9D                      		popf
 10518 000007D1 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10519 000007D3 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10520                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10521                                  
 10522                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10523 000007D5 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10524                                  					; return error
 10525 000007D7 F9                      		stc
 10526                                  
 10527                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10528                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10529                                  
 10530                                  okret2:

 10641                                  ;

 10645                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10646                                  checksingle:		
 10647 0000083A 50                      		push	ax
 10648 0000083B 53                      		push	bx
 10649 0000083C 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10650                                  
 10651                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.

 10759                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10760                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10761                                  ;
 10762                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10763                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10764                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10765                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10766                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10767                                  ;	ds = cs
 10768                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10769                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10770                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10771                                  ;
 10772                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10773                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
