 13444                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13445 00001315 CF                      		iret
 13446                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13447                                  
 13448                                  do_get_bds_vector:
 13449                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13450 00001316 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13451                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13452 0000131B C53E[1901]              		lds	di, [start_bds]
 13453                                  		;lds	di, ds:start_bds
 13454                                  ;ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 13455                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13456                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13457 0000131F CF                      		iret
 13458                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13459                                  
 13460                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13461                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13462                                  
 13463                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 13464                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 13465                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 13466                                  
 13467                                  win386call:				
 13468 00001320 1E                      		push	ds
 13469 00001321 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13470                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13471                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h
 13472 00001326 3C05                    		cmp	al, 5		; Win386_Init
 13473                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 13474 00001328 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 13475 0000132A 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 13476                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 13477 0000132C 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 13478                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13479 0000132E F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 13480                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13481 00001331 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13482                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 13483 00001333 8026[CE08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 13484 00001338 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 13485                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13486                                  
 13487                                  Win386Init:	
 13488                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13489 0000133A F6C201                  		test	dl, 1			
 13490                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13491 0000133D 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13492                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 13493 0000133F 800E[CE08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 13494                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 13495                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 13496 00001344 891E[9C08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx
 13497 00001348 8C06[9E08]              		mov	[SI_Next+2], es
 13498                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI
 13499 0000134C BB[9A08]                		mov	bx, Win386_SI	; 19/10/2022
 13500 0000134F 1E                      		push	ds
 13501 00001350 07                      		pop	es
 13502                                  win_iret:
 13503 00001351 1F                      		pop	ds
 13504                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 13505                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 13506                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13507 00001352 CF                      		iret
 13508                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13509                                  
 13510                                  handle_multmult:			
 13511 00001353 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 13512 00001355 7514                    		jnz	short try_2
 13513 00001357 1E                      		push	ds
 13514 00001358 E84500                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13515                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13516                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 13517                                  		;dec	bx
 13518 0000135B BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 13519 0000135E 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 13520 00001360 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 13521 00001362 F7D3                    		not	bx
 13522 00001364 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 13523 00001366 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 13524 00001368 43                      		inc	bx
 13525                                  try_1:
 13526 00001369 1F                      		pop	ds
 13527                                  		;jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13528                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13529 0000136A CF                      		iret
 13530                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13531                                  
 13532                                  try_2:					
 13533 0000136B 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13534 0000136D 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13535 0000136F 1E                      		push	ds
 13536                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13537                                  		;xor	di, di
 13538                                  		;dec	di
 13539 00001370 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 13540 00001373 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
 13541 00001375 E82800                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13542 00001378 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13543 0000137B 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA
 13544 0000137D F7DF                    		neg	di		; free space in HMA
 13545 0000137F 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13546 00001381 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13547                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13548                                  		;sub	di, di
 13549                                  		;dec	di
 13550 00001383 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 13551                                  		;jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13552                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13553 00001386 1F                      		pop	ds
 13554 00001387 CF                      		iret
 13555                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13556                                  
 13557                                  try_4:					
 13558                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13559 00001388 8B3E[F408]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13560 0000138C 83C30F                  		add	bx, 15
 13561                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h
 13562                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13563 0000138F 80E3F0                  		and	bl, 0F0h
 13564                                  		;add	ds:FreeHMAPtr, bx ; update the free pointer	
 13565 00001392 011E[F408]              		add	[FreeHMAPtr], bx
 13566 00001396 7506                    		jnz	short InsuffHMA
 13567 00001398 C706[F408]FFFF          		mov	word [FreeHMAPtr], 0FFFFh ; -1
 13568                                  		;mov	ds:FreeHMAPtr, 0FFFFh
 13569                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped
 13570                                  InsuffHMA:				
 13571 0000139E 1F                      		pop	ds
 13572                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13573                                  try_3:
 13574                                  		;jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13575                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13576 0000139F CF                      		iret
 13577                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13578                                  
 13579                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13580                                  ;try_3:					
 13581                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret
 13582                                  
 13583                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13584                                  
 13585                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13586                                  
 13587                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13588                                  ;
 13589                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13590                                  ;
 13591                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13592                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13593                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13594                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13595                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13596                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13597                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13598                                  ;
 13599                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13600                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13601                                  ;
 13602                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13603                                  
 13604                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13605                                  HMAPtr:
 13606 000013A0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13607                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13608 000013A5 8B3E[F408]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13609                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13610 000013A9 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13611 000013AC 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13612 000013AE 803E[FA08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13613                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13614 000013B3 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13615 000013B5 FF1E[F608]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13616                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13617 000013B9 8B3E[F408]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13618                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13619                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13620 000013BD C3                      		retn
 13621                                  
 13622                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13623                                  
 13624                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13625                                  
 13626                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13627                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13628                                  
 13629                                  move_sector:
 13630                                  
 13631                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13632                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13633                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13634                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13635                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13636                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13637                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13638                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13639                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13640                                  ;
 13641                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13642                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13643                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13644                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13645                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13646                                  
 13647 000013BE FC                      		cld
 13648 000013BF 51                      		push	cx
 13649 000013C0 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13650 000013C3 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13651 000013C7 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13652 000013C9 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13653 000013CD 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13654 000013CF F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13655 000013D1 59                      		pop	cx
 13656 000013D2 C3                      		retn
 13657                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13658                                  
 13659                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13660 000013D3 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13661 000013D5 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13662 000013D7 59                      		pop	cx
 13663 000013D8 C3                      		retn
 13664                                  
 13665                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13666                                  
 13667                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13668                                  
 13669                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13670                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13671                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13672                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13673                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13674                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13675                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13676                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13677                                  ;
 13678                                  ; input conditions:
 13679                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13680                                  ;
 13681                                  ; output:
 13682                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13683                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13684                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13685                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13686                                  
 13687                                  check_wrap:	
 13688 000013D9 50                      		push	ax
 13689 000013DA 53                      		push	bx
 13690 000013DB 06                      		push	es
 13691 000013DC 57                      		push	di
 13692 000013DD E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13693 000013E0 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13694                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13695 000013E2 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13696                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13697 000013E7 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13698 000013E9 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13699 000013ED 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13700 000013EF 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13701 000013F2 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13702 000013F4 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13703 000013F6 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13704                                  
 13705                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13706                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13707                                  
 13708 000013F8 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13709 000013FA 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13710                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13711 000013FC 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13712 000013FD 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13713                                  					; if on	boundary
 13714                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13715                                  not_on_bound:				
 13716 000013FF 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13717 00001402 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13718 00001404 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13719 00001406 40                      		inc	ax
 13720 00001407 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13721 00001409 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13722                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13723 0000140C 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13724 00001410 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13725                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13726                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13727 00001412 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13728 00001414 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13729 00001415 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13730                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13731 00001417 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13732                                  
 13733                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13734                                  
 13735 00001419 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13736 0000141B 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13737 0000141D 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13738                                  
 13739                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13740                                  
 13741 0000141F 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13742 00001421 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13743 00001423 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13744                                  no_head_bound:				
 13745 00001424 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13746 00001426 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13747 00001427 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13748 00001429 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13749 0000142B 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13750 0000142D 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13751 00001430 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13752 00001432 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13753 00001434 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13754 00001436 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13755 00001438 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13756 0000143A D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13757 0000143C 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13758 0000143E 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13759                                  no_wrap:				
 13760 00001440 F8                      		clc
 13761 00001441 5F                      		pop	di
 13762 00001442 07                      		pop	es
 13763 00001443 5B                      		pop	bx
 13764 00001444 58                      		pop	ax
 13765 00001445 C3                      		retn
 13766                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13767                                  
 13768                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13769 00001446 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13770 00001448 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13771 0000144A EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13772                                  
 13773                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13774                                  
 13775                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13776                                  
 13777                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13778                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13779                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13780                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13781                                  ;
 13782                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13783                                  
 13784                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13785                                  find_bds:	
 13786 0000144C C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13787                                  fbds_1:					
 13788 00001450 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13789 00001454 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13790 00001456 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13791                                  					; go to next bds
 13792 00001459 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13793 0000145C 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13794 0000145E F9                      		stc
 13795                                  fdbs_2:					
 13796 0000145F C3                      		retn
 13797                                  
 13798                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13799                                  
 13800                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13801                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13802                                  doint:
 13803                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13804 00001460 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13805                                  					; get physical drive number
 13806                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13807                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13808                                  		
 13809 00001463 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13810 00001465 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13811 00001467 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13812                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13813 00001469 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13814                                  					; get request code
 13815                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13816 0000146C FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13817                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13818 0000146F 9D                      		popf
 13819                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13820                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13821 00001470 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13822                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13823                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13824 00001475 9C                      		pushf
 13825                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13826 00001476 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13827                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13828                                  dointdone:				
 13829 00001479 C3                      		retn
 13830                                  
 13831                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13832                                  
 13833                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13834                                  
 13835                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13836                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13837                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13838                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13839                                  ;
 13840                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13841                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13842                                  ;
 13843                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13844                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13845                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13846                                  
 13847                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13848                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13849                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13850                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13851                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13852                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13853                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13854                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13855                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13856                                  ;end struc
 13857                                  
 13858                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13859                                  
 13860                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13861                                  ;	ah = function
 13862                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13863                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13864                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13865                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13866                                  ;   output conditions:
 13867                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13868                                  
 13869                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13870                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13871                                  ;
 13872                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13873                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13874                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13875                                  
 13876                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13877                                  
 13878                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13879                                  
 13880 0000147A 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13881                                  
 13882                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13883                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13884                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13885                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13886                                  
 13887                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13888                                  
 13889                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13890                                  
 13891                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13892                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13893                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13894                                  
 13895                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13896 0000147E 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13897 00001483 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13898 00001485 53                      		push	bx
 13899 00001486 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13900 00001489 E83004                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13901 0000148C 5B                      		pop	bx
 13902 0000148D EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13903                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13904                                  
 13905                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13906                                  
 13907                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13908                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13909                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13910                                  
 13911                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13912                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13913 0000148F 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13914 00001491 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13915 00001493 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13916 00001494 51                      		push	cx
 13917 00001495 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13918 00001497 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13919 00001499 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13920 0000149B 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13921 0000149F 59                      		pop	cx
 13922 000014A0 58                      		pop	ax
 13923 000014A1 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13924                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13925 000014A3 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13926 000014A4 06                      		push	es
 13927                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13928 000014A5 2EC41E[7A14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13929                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13930                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13931 000014AA 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13932 000014AC 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13933 000014AF 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13934                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13935                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13936 000014B3 07                      		pop	es
 13937 000014B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 13938 000014B5 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13939                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13940                                  
 13941                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13942                                  
 13943                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13944                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13945                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13946                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13947                                  
 13948                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13949 000014B7 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13950                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13951 000014BC 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13952 000014BE 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13953                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13954 000014C3 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13955                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13956 000014C5 50                      		push	ax
 13957 000014C6 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13958                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13959                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13960 000014C8 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13961                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13962                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13963 000014CD 58                      		pop	ax
 13964 000014CE EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13965                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13966                                  
 13967                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13968                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13969                                  
 13970                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13971                                  
 13972                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13973                                  
 13974                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13975                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13976                                  
 13977                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13978 000014D0 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13979                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13980                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13981 000014D1 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13982                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13983                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13984                                  
 13985                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13986                                  
 13987 000014D6 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13988 000014D9 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13989 000014DC 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13990                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13991                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13992 000014DE 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13993 000014E3 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13994                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13995                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13996                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13997 000014E5 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13998                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13999                                  		
 14000 000014EA 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14001                                  		
 14002 000014EB 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14003                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14004 000014F0 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14005                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14006                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 14007 000014F2 9D                      		popf
 14008 000014F3 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14009                                  ret_from_i13:				
 14010 000014F5 1F                      		pop	ds
 14011 000014F6 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14012                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14013                                  
 14014                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14015                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14016                                  ; a changeline error.
 14017                                  
 14018                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 14019 000014F9 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14020                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14021 000014FB 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14022 000014FE 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14023 00001500 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14024 00001502 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14025 00001504 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14026 00001509 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14027                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14028                                  					; never	would
 14029 0000150B 53                      		push	bx
 14030 0000150C BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14031 0000150F E8AA03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14032 00001512 5B                      		pop	bx
 14033                                  int13b:					
 14034 00001513 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14035 00001514 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14036                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14037                                  
 14038                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14039                                  
 14040                                  goterr13:				
 14041 00001516 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14042 00001519 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14043                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14044 0000151B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14045 0000151E 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14046 00001520 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14047 00001525 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14048                                  
 14049 00001527 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14050                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14051                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14052                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14053 0000152C 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14054                                  
 14055 0000152E 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14056                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14057                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14058 00001530 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14059                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14060                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14061 00001535 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14062 00001538 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14063 0000153A 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14064 0000153C 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14065 0000153E 53                      		push	bx
 14066 0000153F 51                      		push	cx
 14067 00001540 52                      		push	dx
 14068 00001541 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14069                                  loop_ecc:				
 14070 00001544 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14071                                  
 14072                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14073                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14074                                  ;
 14075                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14076                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14077                                  ; track.
 14078                                  ;
 14079                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14080                                  ; this request.
 14081                                  ;
 14082                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14083                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14084                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14085                                  ;
 14086 00001547 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14087                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14088                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14089 0000154A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14090                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14091 0000154F 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14092 00001551 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14093 00001554 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14094 00001556 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14095 00001559 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14096                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14097                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14098                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14099 0000155B 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14100                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14101                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14102                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14103                                  ok11_op:				
 14104 0000155D FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14105 00001561 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14106 00001563 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14107                                  					; add 200h to address
 14108 00001565 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14109 00001567 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14110 00001569 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14111                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14112                                  
 14113                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14114                                  
 14115                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 14116 0000156B F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14117                                  ok11_exit:				
 14118 0000156C 5A                      		pop	dx
 14119 0000156D 59                      		pop	cx
 14120 0000156E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14121 0000156F EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14122                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14123                                  
 14124                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14125                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14126                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14127                                  
 14128                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 14129 00001571 06                      		push	es
 14130 00001572 53                      		push	bx
 14131 00001573 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14132 00001576 1E                      		push	ds
 14133 00001577 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14134 00001578 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14135                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14136                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14137 0000157B 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14138                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14139 00001580 5B                      		pop	bx
 14140 00001581 07                      		pop	es
 14141 00001582 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14142 00001584 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14143 00001587 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14144                                  
 14145                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14146                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14147                                  
 14148                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14149 00001589 56                      		push	si
 14150 0000158A 57                      		push	di
 14151 0000158B 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14152 0000158D BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14153 00001590 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14154 00001593 5F                      		pop	di
 14155 00001594 5E                      		pop	si
 14156 00001595 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14157                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14158                                  
 14159                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14160                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14161                                  
 14162                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14163 00001597 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14164 0000159A FB                      		sti
 14165 0000159B 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14166 0000159E 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14167                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14168                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14169 000015A0 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14170 000015A3 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14171 000015A5 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14172 000015A8 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14173 000015AA 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14174                                  
 14175                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14176                                  
 14177                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14178                                  
 14179 000015AC 52                      		push	dx
 14180 000015AD 51                      		push	cx
 14181 000015AE 53                      		push	bx
 14182 000015AF 50                      		push	ax
 14183 000015B0 55                      		push	bp
 14184 000015B1 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14185 000015B3 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14186 000015B5 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14187 000015B7 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14188 000015B9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14189 000015BB D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14190 000015BD 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14191 000015BF 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14192                                  
 14193                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14194                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14195                                  
 14196 000015C3 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14197 000015C5 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14198                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14199                                  
 14200                                  no_skip_first:				
 14201 000015C8 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14202 000015CA B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14203 000015CC 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14204                                  
 14205                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14206                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14207                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14208                                  ;
 14209                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14210                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14211                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14212                                  ; in error.
 14213                                  
 14214 000015CE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14215 000015D0 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14216                                  
 14217                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14218                                  
 14219 000015D2 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14220                                  					; set up head number
 14221 000015D5 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14222 000015D8 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14223                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14224                                  
 14225                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14226 000015DB B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14227 000015DD F9                      		stc
 14228 000015DE E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14229                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14230                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14231                                  
 14232                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14233                                  
 14234                                  intverify:				
 14235 000015E1 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14236 000015E2 53                      		push	bx
 14237 000015E3 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14238 000015E4 07                      		pop	es
 14239                                  dosimple:				
 14240 000015E5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14241                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14242                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14243                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14244 000015E8 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14245                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14246 000015ED 5B                      		pop	bx
 14247 000015EE 07                      		pop	es
 14248 000015EF E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14249                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14250                                  
 14251                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14252                                  
 14253                                  intformat:				
 14254 000015F2 06                      		push	es
 14255 000015F3 53                      		push	bx
 14256 000015F4 56                      		push	si
 14257 000015F5 57                      		push	di
 14258 000015F6 1E                      		push	ds
 14259                                  
 14260                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14261                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14262                                  
 14263 000015F7 06                      		push	es
 14264 000015F8 1E                      		push	ds
 14265 000015F9 07                      		pop	es
 14266 000015FA 1F                      		pop	ds
 14267 000015FB 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14268 000015FD BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14269 00001600 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14270 00001603 1F                      		pop	ds
 14271 00001604 5F                      		pop	di
 14272 00001605 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14273 00001606 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14274                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14275                                  
 14276                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14277                                  ; the first block.
 14278                                  ;
 14279                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14280                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14281                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14282                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14283                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14284                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14285                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14286                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14287                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14288                                  
 14289                                  doblock:
 14290                                  
 14291                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14292                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14293                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14294                                  				
 14295 00001608 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14296                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14297 0000160B 51                      		push	cx
 14298 0000160C 06                      		push	es
 14299 0000160D 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14300                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14301 0000160E E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14302 00001611 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14303                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14304 00001615 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14305                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14306 0000161A 5F                      		pop	di
 14307 0000161B 07                      		pop	es
 14308 0000161C 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14309 0000161E 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14310 00001620 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14311 00001622 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14312                                  doblockflop:				
 14313 00001624 59                      		pop	cx
 14314                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14315 00001625 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14316 00001627 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14317 00001629 50                      		push	ax
 14318 0000162A 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14319 0000162C EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14320                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14321                                  
 14322                                  doblocklast:				
 14323 0000162E 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14324 00001630 50                      		push	ax
 14325                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14326 00001631 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14327 00001634 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14328 00001636 58                      		pop	ax
 14329 00001637 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14330                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14331 0000163A 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14332 0000163C 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14333 0000163E 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14334 00001640 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14335 00001642 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14336                                  					; then we are done already.
 14337 00001644 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14338                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14339 00001646 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14340 00001649 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14341                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14342                                  
 14343                                  bufferx:				
 14344 0000164B 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14345                                  					; set up head number
 14346                                  buffer:					
 14347 0000164E 53                      		push	bx
 14348 0000164F 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14349 00001652 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14350 00001655 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14351                                  					
 14352                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14353                                  
 14354 00001657 06                      		push	es
 14355 00001658 1E                      		push	ds
 14356 00001659 56                      		push	si
 14357 0000165A 57                      		push	di
 14358 0000165B 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14359 0000165C 06                      		push	es
 14360 0000165D 1F                      		pop	ds
 14361 0000165E 07                      		pop	es
 14362 0000165F BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14363 00001662 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14364 00001663 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14365 00001665 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14366 00001668 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14367                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14368 00001669 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14369 0000166A 5E                      		pop	si
 14370 0000166B 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14371                                  
 14372                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14373                                  
 14374 0000166C B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14375                                  					; get drive number
 14376 0000166E 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14377 00001671 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14378                                  					;
 14379                                  					; ah is	function
 14380                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14381                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14382                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14383                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14384                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14385 00001674 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14386 00001677 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14387 00001678 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14388 0000167A EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14389                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14390                                  
 14391                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14392                                  
 14393                                  doread:					
 14394 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 14395 0000167D 53                      		push	bx
 14396 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14397 0000167F 07                      		pop	es
 14398 00001680 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14399 00001683 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14400 00001685 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14401                                  					; get drive number
 14402 00001688 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14403                                  					; ah = function
 14404                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14405                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14406                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14407 0000168B E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14408 0000168E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14409 0000168F 07                      		pop	es
 14410 00001690 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14411 00001692 56                      		push	si
 14412 00001693 57                      		push	di
 14413 00001694 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14414 00001696 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14415 00001699 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14416 0000169C 5F                      		pop	di
 14417 0000169D 5E                      		pop	si
 14418                                  
 14419                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14420                                  
 14421                                  dotail:					
 14422 0000169E 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14423 0000169F 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14424 000016A2 41                      		inc	cx
 14425 000016A3 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14426 000016A6 F8                      		clc
 14427 000016A7 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14428 000016A9 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14429                                  
 14430                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14431                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14432                                  
 14433 000016AB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14434 000016AE E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14435 000016B1 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14436                                  
 14437                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14438                                  
 14439                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14440                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14441                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14442                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14443                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14444                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14445                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14446                                  
 14447                                  bad13:					
 14448 000016B4 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14449 000016B6 5D                      		pop	bp
 14450 000016B7 5B                      		pop	bx
 14451 000016B8 5B                      		pop	bx
 14452 000016B9 59                      		pop	cx
 14453 000016BA 5A                      		pop	dx
 14454 000016BB 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14455 000016BD E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14456                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14457                                  
 14458                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14459 000016C0 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14460                                  
 14461                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14462                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14463                                  		;db 	0
 14464                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14465                                  
 14466                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14467

 14475                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14476                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14477 000016C3 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14478 000016C7 BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 14479 000016CA 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 14480 000016CB 07                      		pop	es
 14481 000016CC E9E9EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 14482                                  
 14483                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14484                                  
 14485                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14486                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14487                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14488                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14489                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14490                                  
 14491                                  install_bds:		
 14492 000016CF 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14493 000016D0 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14494                                  
 14495                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14496                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14497                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14498 000016D3 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14499                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14500 000016D5 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14501 000016D9 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14502                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14503 000016DC 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14504 000016DE B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14505 000016E0 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14506                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14507 000016E4 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14508 000016E7 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14509                                  					; we don't own it
 14510 000016EC 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14511                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14512 000016EF 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14513 000016F2 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14514                                  next_bds:				
 14515                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14516 000016F6 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14517 000016F9 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14518                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14519                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14520 000016FB 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14521 000016FD 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14522                                  					; install bds
 14523 00001700 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14524 00001702 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14525                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14526                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14527 00001705 1F                      		pop	ds
 14528                                  
 14529                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14530                                  ;
 14531                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14532                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14533                                  ;
 14534                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14535                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14536                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14537                                  ;
 14538                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14539                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14540                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14541                                  
 14542 00001706 C3                      		retn
 14543

 14551                                  SNGMSG equ sngmsg

 14556                                  ;  ask to swap the disk in drive a:
 14557                                  ;	es:di -> bds
 14558                                  ;	ds -> Bios_Data
