 15518                                  
 15519                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15520                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 15521                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15522                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 31/12/2022))
 15523                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15524                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 15525                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15526                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 15527                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15528                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit5.s -l sysinit5.lst -o SYSINIT5.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 15529                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15530                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 15531                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15532                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 15533                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 15534                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15535                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 15536                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 15537                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15538                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 15539                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 15540                                  
 15541                                  ; 21/10/2022
 15542                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15543                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 15544                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 15545                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 15546                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15547                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 15548                                  
 15549                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15550                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 15551                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15552                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 15553                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 15554                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 15555                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 15556                                  ;
 15557                                  ;
 15558                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 15559                                  ;
 15560                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 15561                                  ;
 15562                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 15563                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15564                                  ;
 15565                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 15566                                  ;
 15567                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 15568                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15569                                  ;
 15570                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 15571                                  ;
 15572                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 15573                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 15574                                  ;value.
 15575                                  ;
 15576                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 15577                                  ;
 15578                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 15579                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 15580                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 15581                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 15582                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 15583                                  ;
 15584                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 15585                                  ;
 15586                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 15587                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 15588                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 15589                                  ;
 15590                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 15591                                  ;
 15592                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 15593                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15594                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 15595                                  ;
 15596                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 15597                                  ;
 15598                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 15599                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15600                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 15601                                  ;
 15602                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 15603                                  ;
 15604                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 15605                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 15606                                  ;
 15607                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 15608                                  ;
 15609                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 15610                                  ;
 15611                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 15612                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 15613                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 15614                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 15615                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 15616                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 15617                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 15618                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 15619                                  ;memory.
 15620                                  ;NOTES:
 15621                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 15622                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 15623                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 15624                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 15625                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 15626                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 15627                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 15628                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 15629                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 15630                                  
 15631                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15632                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 15633                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15634                                  
 15635                                  ;include version.inc
 15636                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15637                                  
 15638                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 15639                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 15640                                  
 15641                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 15642                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 15643                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 15644                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 15645                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 15646                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 15647                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 15648                                  
 15649                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 15650                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15651                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 15652                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 15653                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15654                                  
 15655                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 15656                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15657                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 15658                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 15659                                  
 15660                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 15661                                  
 15662                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 15663                                  				; currently 0.
 15664                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 15665                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 15666                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 15667                                  
 15668                                  ;      if1
 15669                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 15670                                  ;      endif
 15671                                  
 15672                                         ;******************************
 15673                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 15674                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 15675                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 15676                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 15677                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 15678                                         ;******************************
 15679                                  
 15680                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15681                                  ; device definitions
 15682                                  
 15683                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 15684                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 15685                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 15686                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 15687                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 15688                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 15689                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 15690                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 15691                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 15692                                  
 15693                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 15694                                  struc	SYSDEV
 15695 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 15696 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 15697 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 15698 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 15699 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 15700                                  .size:
 15701                                  endstruc
 15702                                  
 15703                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 15704                                  struc	SRHEAD
 15705 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 15706 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 15707 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 15708 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 15709 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 15710                                  .size:
 15711                                  endstruc
 15712                                  
 15713                                  ;Status word masks
 15714                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 15715                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 15716                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 15717                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 15718                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 15719                                  
 15720                                  ;Function codes
 15721                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 15722                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 15723                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 15724                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 15725                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 15726                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 15727                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 15728                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 15729                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 15730                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 15731                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 15732                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 15733                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 15734                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 15735                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 15736                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 15737                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 15738                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 15739                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 15740                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 15741                                  
 15742                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15743                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 15744 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 15745 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 15746 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 15747 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 15748 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 15749 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 15750                                                          ; word
 15751 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 15752 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 15753 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 15754 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 15755                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 15756                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 15757                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15758                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15759                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15760                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15761                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 15762                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15763 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 15764 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 15765 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 15766 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 15767 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 15768 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 15769                                  .size:
 15770                                  endstruc
 15771                                  
 15772                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15773                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15774                                  
 15775                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15776                                  
 15777                                  struc buffinfo
 15778 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15779 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15780 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15781                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15782                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15783 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15784                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15785                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15786                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15787                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15788                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15789                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15790                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15791                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15792 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15793                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15794 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15795 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15796 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15797 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15798 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15799                                  .size:
 15800                                  endstruc
 15801                                  
 15802                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15803                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15804                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15805                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15806                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15807                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15808                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15809                                  
 15810                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15811                                  
 15812                                  
 15813                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15814                                  
 15815                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15816                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15817                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15818                                  ;***
 15819                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15820                                  ;***
 15821                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15822                                  
 15823                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15824                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15825                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15826                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15827                                  
 15828                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 15832                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15833                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15834                                  
 15835                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15836                                  
 15837                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15838                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15839                                  ;
 15840                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15841                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15842                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15843                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15844                                  ;
 15845                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15846                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15847                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15848                                  
 15849                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15850                                  
 15851                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15852                                  
 15853                                  struc	DPB
 15854 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15855 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15856 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15857 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15858 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15859 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15860 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15861 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15862 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15863 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15864                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15865 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15866 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15867 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15868 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15869 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15870                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15871 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15872 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15873 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15874                                  .size:
 15875                                  endstruc
 15876                                  
 15877                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15878                                  
 15879                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 15936                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15937                                  
 15938                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15939                                  ;
 15940                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15941                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15942                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15943                                  ;
 15944                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15945                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15946                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15947                                  ;
 15948                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15949                                  
 15950                                  struc A_BPB
 15951 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15952 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15953 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15954 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15955 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15956 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15957 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15958 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15959 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15960 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15961 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15962 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15963 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15964 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15965 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15966                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15967                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15968                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15969                                  .size:
 15970                                  endstruc
 15971                                  
 15972                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 15973 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 15974 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 15975 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 15976 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 15977 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 15978 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 15979 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 15980 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 15981                                  endstruc

 16043 00000000 ????                    .EXIT_CALL:	resw 1   	; INT int_abort system terminate
 16044 00000002 ????                    .BLOCK_LEN:	resw 1		; size of execution block
 16045 00000004 ??                                      resb 1
 16046 00000005 ??????????              .CPM_CALL:	resb 5		; ancient call to system
 16047 0000000A ????????                .EXIT:		resd 1		; pointer to exit routine
 16048 0000000E ????????                .CTRL_C:	resd 1		; pointer to ^C routine
 16049 00000012 ????????                .FATAL_ABORT:	resd 1		; pointer to fatal error
 16050 00000016 ????                    .PARENT_PID:	resw 1		; PID of parent (terminate PID)
 16051 00000018 <res 14h>               .JFN_TABLE:     resb FILPERPROC ; indices into system table
 16052 0000002C ????                    .ENVIRON:	resw 1		; seg addr of environment
 16053 0000002E ????????                .USER_STACK:	resd 1		; stack of self during system calls
 16054 00000032 ????                    .JFN_LENGTH:	resw 1 		; number of handles allowed
 16055 00000034 ????????                .JFN_POINTER:	resd 1 		; pointer to JFN table
 16056 00000038 ????????                .NEXT_PDB:	resd 1		; pointer to nested PDB's
 16057 0000003C ??                      .INTERCON:	resb 1 		; *** jh-3/28/90 ***
 16058 0000003D ??                      .APPEND:	resb 1		; *** Not sure if still used ***
 16059 0000003E ????                    .NOVELL_USED:	resb 2		; Novell shell (redir) uses these
 16060 00000040 ????                    .VERSION:	resw 1		; DOS version reported to this app
 16061 00000042 <res Eh>                .PAD1:		resb 14		; 	
 16062 00000050 ??????????              .CALL_SYSTEM:	resb 5		; portable method of system call

 16229                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16230                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 16231                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16232                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 16233                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 16234                                  									  
 16235                                  ;*******************************					  
 16236                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 16237                                  ;*******************************					  
 16238                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 16239                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 16240                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 16241                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16242                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 16243                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 16244                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16245                                  ;For all others:							  
 16246                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 16247                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 16248                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 16249                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 16250                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 16251                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 16252                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 16253                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 16254                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16255                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 16256                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 16257                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 16258                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 16259                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 16260                                  ;									  
 16261                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 16262                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 16263                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16264                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 16265                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 16266                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 16267                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16268                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16269                                  ;									  
 16270                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16271                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16272                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16273                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16274                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16275                                  ;									  
 16276                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16277                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16278                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16279                                  ;									  
 16280                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16281                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16282                                  ;									  
 16283                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16284                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16285                                  ;									  
 16286                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16287                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16288                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 16289                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 16290                                  ;						called. 		  
 16291                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 16292                                  ;									  
 16293                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16294                                  ;									  
 16295                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16296                                  ;									  
 16297                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16298                                  ;									  
 16299                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16300                                  ;									  
 16301                                  
 16302                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 16303                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 16304 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 16305 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 16306                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 16307 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16308 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16309 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 16310 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 16311                                  endstruc

 16420                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16421                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16422                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16423                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16424                                  
 16425                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 16426                                  ;
 16427                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 16428                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 16429                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 16430                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 16431                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 16432                                  ;
 16433                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 16434                                  ;
 16435                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 16436                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 16437                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 16438                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 16439                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 16440                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 16441                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 16442                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 16443                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 16444                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16445                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16446                                  
 16447                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16448                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16449                                  
 16450                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16451                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16452 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16453 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16454 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16455 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16456 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16457 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16458                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16459 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 16460 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 16461 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 16462                                  .size:
 16463                                  endstruc
 16464                                  
 16465                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 16466                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 16467                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 16468                                  						; argument
 16469                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 16470

 16480                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16481                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16482                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16483                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16484                                  
 16485                                  ; system file table
 16486                                  
 16487                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16488                                  ;
 16489                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16490                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16491                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16492                                  
 16493                                  struc	SF
 16494 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16495 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16496 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16497                                  .size:
 16498                                  endstruc
 16499                                  
 16500                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16501                                  ;
 16502                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16503                                  
 16504                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16505 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16506                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16507 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16508 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16509 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16510                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16511                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16512                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16513                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16514                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16515                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16516                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16517                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16518                                  					;
 16519                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16520                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16521                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16522                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16523                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16524                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16525                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16526                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16527                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16528                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16529                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16530                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16531 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 16532                                  					; to device header if local device,
 16533                                  					; points to net device header if
 16534                                  					; remote
 16535 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 16536                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *

 16842                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16843                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16844                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16845                                  
 16846                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16847                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16848                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16849                                  
 16850                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16851                                  ;
 16852                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16853                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16854                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16855                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16856                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16857                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16858                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16859                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16860                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16861                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16862                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16863                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16864                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16865                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16866                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16867                                  ;
 16868                                  
 16869                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16870                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16871                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16872                                  ;
 16873                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16874                                  ;
 16875                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16876                                  ;
 16877                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16878                                  ;
 16879                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16880                                  ;
 16881                                  
 16882                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16883                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16884                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16885                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16886                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16887                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16888                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16889                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16890                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16891                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16892                                  
 16893                                  		;EVEN
 16894                                  ;align 2
 16895                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16896                                  
 16897 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16898 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16899 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16900 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16901 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16902 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16903                                  
 16904 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16905 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16906 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16907                                  
 16908                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16909                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16910                                  
 16911                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16912                                  
 16913 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16914                                  
 16915                                  int02:
 16916                                  
 16917                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16918                                  ;
 16919                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16920                                  ;
 16921                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16922                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16923                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16924                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16925                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16926                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16927                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16928                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16929                                  ;
 16930                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16931                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16932                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16933                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16934                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16935                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16936                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16937                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16938                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16939                                  ;
 16940                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16941                                  
 16942 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16943 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16944 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16945 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16946                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16947 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16948 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16949 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16950                                  
 16951 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16952                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16953                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16954                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16955                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16956 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16957 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 16958                                  special02:
 16959 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 16960 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 16961                                  normal02:
 16962 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 16963 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16964 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02
 16965                                  
 16966                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16967                                  
 16968 00000038 00000000                old08:	dd	0
 16969                                  
 16970                                  int08:
 16971 0000003C E80801                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16972 0000003F [3800]                  	dw	old08
 16973                                  
 16974                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16975                                  
 16976 00000041 00000000                old09:	dd	0
 16977                                  
 16978                                  int09:
 16979                                  
 16980                                  ; keyboard interrupt must have a three byte jump, a nop and a zero byte
 16981                                  ; as its first instruction for compatibility reasons
 16982                                  
 16983 00000045 EB02                    	jmp	short keyboard_lbl
 16984 00000047 90                      	nop
 16985 00000048 00                      	db	0
 16986

 16989 0000004C [4100]                  	dw	old09

 16992

 16997 00000055 [4E00]                  	dw	old70
 16998                                  
 16999                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17000                                  
 17001                                  ;	irp	a,<0a,0b,0c,0d,0e,72,73,74,76,77>
 17002                                  ;public	int&a
 17003                                  ;public	old&a
 17004                                  ;public	firstflag&a
 17005                                  ;int&a	proc	far

 17192                                  ;********************************************************************
 17193                                  ;common routines
 17194                                  ;********************************************************************
 17195                                  
 17196                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 17197                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 17198                                  ; service routine
 17199                                  
 17200                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 17201                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17202                                  
 17203                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 17204                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 17205                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 17206                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 17207                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 17208                                  
 17209                                  do_int_stacks:
 17210 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 17211 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 17212 00000149 06                      	push	es
 17213 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 17214 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 17215 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 17216                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17217                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 17218                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17219 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 17220 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 17221 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 17222                                  
 17223 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 17224                                  
 17225                                  found02:
 17226 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 17227 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 17228                                  
 17229 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 17230                                  
 17231 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 17232                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17233                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 17234                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17235                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 17236 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 17237 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 17238                                  
 17239                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 17240                                  	;mov	es,bp
 17241                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 17242                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 17243                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 17244                                  	;mov	sp,es
 17245                                  	;mov	es,ax
 17246                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 17247                                  
 17248                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 17249 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 17250 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 17251 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 17252 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 17253 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 17254 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 17255 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 17256 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 17257                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17258                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 17259 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 17260                                  
 17261 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 17262                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17263 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 17264                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17265                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 17266                                  
 17267 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 17268                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17269 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 17270                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17271                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 17272 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 17273 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 17274                                  
 17275                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17276                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 17277                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17278 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 17279 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 17280                                  
 17281 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 17282 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 17283 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 17284 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 17285 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 17286                                  
 17287                                  notfree02:
 17288 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 17289 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 17290                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17291                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 17292                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17293 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17294                                  
 17295                                  findnext02:
 17296 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 17297 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 17298                                  
 17299                                  foundbad02:
 17300 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17301 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 17302 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 17303                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17304                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 17305                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17306 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 17307 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 17308                                  
 17309                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17310                                  
 17311                                  ; Common routines
 17312                                  
 17313                                  longpath:
 17314                                  	; 21/03/2019
 17315 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 17316                                  lploopp:
 17317                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17318                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 17319                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17320 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 17321 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 17322                                  
 17323 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 17324                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17325                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 17326                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17327 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17328 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 17329 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 17330                                  
 17331 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 17332 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 17333                                  
 17334                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17335                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 17336                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17337 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 17338                                  inuse:
 17339 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17340 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 17341 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 17342 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 17343                                  found:
 17344 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 17345                                  fatal:
 17346 000001F5 1E                      	push	ds
 17347 000001F6 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 17348 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 17349 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 17350 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 17351 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 17352                                  
 17353 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 17354 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 17355                                  
 17356                                  skip_nmis:
 17357 00000207 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 17358 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 17359 0000020A E621                    	out	021h,al
 17360 0000020C E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 17361                                  
 17362 0000020E 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 17363 00000210 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 17364 00000212 BE[3902]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 17365                                  ;SR;
 17366                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 17367                                  ;
 17368 00000215 50                      	push	ax
 17369 00000216 1E                      	push	ds
 17370                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 17371                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 17372                                  	; 21/10/2022

 17374 0000021A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 17375                                  
 17376                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 17377 0000021C F606[CE08]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 17378 00000221 1F                      	pop	ds
 17379 00000222 58                      	pop	ax
 17380 00000223 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 17381

 17383                                  	;call	KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; set focus to this VM
 17384                                  	; 21/10/2022

 17388                                  ;
 17389                                  fatal_loop:

 17393

 17946                                  ; The DOS code is ORGed at a non-zero value to allow it to be located in
 17947                                  ; HIMEM. Thus, the DOS segment location must be adjusted accordingly.
 17948                                  ; If this is ROMDOS, however, only the init code is loaded into RAM, so
 17949                                  ; this ORG is not done. The entry point is at offset zero in the segment.

 18560                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18561                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18562                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18563                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18564                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18565                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18566                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18567                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18568                                  ;
 18569                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18570                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18571                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18572                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18573                                  ; been patched.

 18853                                  
 18854                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"
 18855                                  ;   in memory, can be trashed (and in fact is -- see references to retry
 18856                                  ;   which follow....)
 18857                                  
 18858                                  retry:
 18859 000007D4 BA[5C33]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18860                                  
 18861                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18862                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18863                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18864                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18865                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18866                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18867                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18868                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18869                                  
 18870                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18871                                  
 18872 000007D7 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 18873 000007D8 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 18874 000007DB B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18875 000007DD CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 18876 000007DF B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18877 000007E1 CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 18878 000007E3 7243                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 18879                                  
 18880 000007E5 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18881 000007E7 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 18882 000007E9 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 18883 000007EB 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 18884                                  
 18885                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18886                                  
 18887                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18888                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18889                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18890                                  
 18891                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18892                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 18893 000007ED 8B1E[9202]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 18894 000007F1 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18895                                  
 18896                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18897                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18898                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18899                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18900                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18901                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18902                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18903                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18904                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18905                                  ;
 18906                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18907                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18908                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18909                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18910                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18911                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18912                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 18913                                  
 18914                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18915                                  	;mov	cx,[config_envlen]
 18916                                          ;jcxz	no_env		; use config_wrkseg only if there's env data
