 19300                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19301                                  ;
 19302                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 19303                                  ;
 19304                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 19305                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 19306                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 19307                                  ;
 19308                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 19309                                  ;
 19310                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19311                                  
 19312                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19313                                  MovDOSHi:
 19314                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19315                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19316                                  	; ds = cs
 19317 000008E9 E8D500                  	call	AllocHMA
 19318 000008EC 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 19319 000008EE B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 19320 000008F1 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19321                                  
 19322                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19323                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 19324                                  
 19325                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 19326                                  	; 24/03/2019
 19327                                  	
 19328                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19329 000008F3 E83200                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 19330                                  
 19331                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 19332                                  	
 19333                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19334                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19335                                  	;xor	di,di
 19336                                  	
 19337                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19338                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 19339                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19340                                  	; ds = cs
 19341 000008F6 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 19342 000008FA E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 19343                                  
 19344                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 19345                                  ;else
 19346                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 19347                                  ;
 19348                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 19349                                  ;
 19350                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19351                                  
 19352 000008FD E85D02                  	call	SaveFreeHMAPtr			; Save the Free HMA ptr
 19353 00000900 F8                      	clc
 19354                                  mdhx:
 19355 00000901 C3                      	retn

 19683                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19684                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19685                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19686                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19687                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19688                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19689                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19690                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19691                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19692                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19693                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19694                                  ;
 19695                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19696                                  
 19697                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19698                                  update_arena:
 19699 0000097A 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19700 0000097B 57                      	push	di
 19701 0000097C 51                      	push	cx
 19702 0000097D 52                      	push	dx
 19703                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19704                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19705                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19706                                  	; ds = cs 
 19707 0000097E C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19708 00000982 4F                      	dec	di
 19709 00000983 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19710                                  						;  before sysvar
 19711 00000984 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19712                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19713 00000986 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19714 0000098B 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19715 0000098D 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19716                                  
 19717                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19718 0000098F 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19719 00000994 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19720 00000996 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19721 00000998 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19722 0000099A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19723                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19724 0000099C 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19725                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19726 000009A0 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19727 000009A6 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19728                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19729 000009A8 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19730 000009AC 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19731                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19732                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19733 000009AE 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19734 000009B1 5A                      	pop	dx
 19735 000009B2 59                      	pop	cx
 19736 000009B3 5F                      	pop	di
 19737 000009B4 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19738 000009B5 C3                      	retn
 19739                                  ;
 19740                                  ; M012 : END
 19741                                  ;

 19759                                  ;
 19760                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19761                                  ;
 19762                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19763                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19764                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19765                                  ;
 19766                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19767                                  ;
 19768                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19769                                  
 19770                                  AllocHMA:
 19771                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19772                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19773                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19774                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19775                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19776                                  
 19777                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19778                                  ;
 19779                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19780                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19781                                  ;	push	ax
 19782                                  ;	popf
 19783                                  ;	pushf
 19784                                  ;	pop	ax
 19785                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19786                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19787                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19788                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19789                                  
 19790                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19791                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19792                                  
 19793 000009C1 1E                      	push	ds
 19794                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19795                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19796                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19797 000009C2 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19798 000009C5 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19799                                  
 19800 000009C7 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19801 000009CA 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19802                                  
 19803 000009CC B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19804 000009CF CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19805                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19806                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19807                                  
 19808 000009D1 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19809                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 19810 000009D5 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19811                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19812                                  
 19813 000009D9 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19814 000009DB BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19815                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19816 000009DE FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19817 000009E2 48                      	dec	ax
 19818 000009E3 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19819                                  
 19820                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19821                                  
 19822 000009E5 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19823 000009E7 CD15                    	int	15h
 19824                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19825                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19826                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19827 000009E9 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19828                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19829                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19830 000009EC 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19831                                  allocHMA_1:
 19832 000009EE B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19833                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19834 000009F0 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19835 000009F4 48                      	dec	ax
 19836 000009F5 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 19837                                  
 19838 000009F7 E88501                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 19839 000009FA 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 19840                                  
 19841 000009FC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19842 000009FF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19843 00000A01 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 19844 00000A08 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 19845                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 19846                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19847 00000A0F 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 19848                                  
 19849                                  ; 11/12/2022
 19850                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 19851                                  ;	; cf=0
 19852                                  ;	;clc
 19853                                  ;	pop	ds
 19854                                  ;	retn
 19855                                  
 19856                                  grabhma_error:
 19857 00000A11 F9                      	stc
 19858                                  	; 11/12/022
 19859                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 19860                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 19861 00000A12 1F                      	pop	ds
 19862 00000A13 C3                      	retn

 19866                                  ; procedure : IsXMSLoaded
 19867                                  ;
 19868                                  ;             Checks whether a XMS driver is loaded
 19869                                  ;
 19870                                  ; Returns : Z flag set if XMS driver loaded
 19871                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present

 19873                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 19875                                  IsXMSLoaded:

 19879                                  				; AL <> 80h no driver

 19881 00000A1B C3                      	retn

 19928                                  
 19929                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19930                                  ;
 19931                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19932                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19933                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19934                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19935                                  ;
 19936                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19937                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19938                                  ;
 19939                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19940                                  
 19941                                  StartVDHead:
 19942                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19943                                  
 19944 00000A39 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19945 00000A3D 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19946 00000A3F 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19947 00000A41 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19948 00000A43 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19949                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19950 00000A44 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19951                                  VDiskSig1:
 19952 00000A4B 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19953                                  
 19954                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19955                                  
 19956 00000A50 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19957                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19958 00000A56 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19959 00000A65 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19960 00000A67 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19961                                  VDInt19:
 19962 00000A68 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19963                                  OldVDInt19:
 19964 00000A69 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19965                                  
 19966                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19967                                  
 19968                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19969 00000A6D 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19970                                  VDiskSig2:
 19971 00000A70 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19972                                  
 19973                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19974                                  
 19975 00000A75 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19976 00000A78 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19977 00000A7A 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19978 00000A7B 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19979 00000A7D 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19980 00000A7E 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19981 00000A80 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19982 00000A82 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19983 00000A83 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19984 00000A85 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19985 00000A87 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19986 00000A89 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19987 00000A8B 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19988                                  
 19989                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19990                                  
 19991                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19992                                  ;
 19993                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19994                                  ;
 19995                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19996                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19997                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19998                                  ;
 19999                                  ; Inputs : None
 20000                                  ;
 20001                                  ; Outputs : None
 20002                                  ;
 20003                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20004                                  ;
 20005                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20006                                  
 20007                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20008                                  
 20009                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20010 00000A8D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20011 00000A8F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20012                                  
 20013                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20014                                  
 20015                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20016 00000A91 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20017                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20018 00000A94 2EA3[690A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20019 00000A98 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20020                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20021 00000A9B 2EA3[6B0A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20022                                  
 20023                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20024                                  
 20025 00000A9F B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20026                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20027                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20028 00000AA1 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20029 00000AA4 CD21                    	int	21h
 20030                                  
 20031                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20032                                  
 20033 00000AA6 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20034 00000AA7 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20035                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20036 00000AA9 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20037                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20038 00000AB0 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20039 00000AB7 40                      	inc	ax
 20040 00000AB8 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20041                                  
 20042                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20043                                  
 20044 00000ABA FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20045                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20046 00000ABB C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20047 00000AC1 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20048                                  
 20049                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20050                                  
 20051                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20052 00000AC4 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20053 00000AC7 BE[390A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20054 00000ACA 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20055 00000ACC 0E                      	push	cs
 20056 00000ACD 1F                      	pop	ds
 20057 00000ACE FC                      	cld
 20058 00000ACF F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20059 00000AD1 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20060                                  
 20061                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20062                                  
 20063                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20064 00000AD2 57                      	push	di
 20065 00000AD3 06                      	push	es
 20066                                  
 20067                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20068                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20069                                  	; 04/09/2023
 20070 00000AD4 49                      	dec	cx
 20071                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20072 00000AD5 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20073                                  
 20074 00000AD7 BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20075                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20076 00000ADA B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20077 00000ADD BE[6D0A]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20078 00000AE0 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20079                                  
 20080 00000AE2 5F                      	pop	di
 20081 00000AE3 07                      	pop	es
 20082                                  
 20083 00000AE4 C3                      	retn

 20087                                  ;

 20090                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session

 20094                                  struc desc
 20095 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 20096 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 20097 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address

 20132                                  
 20133                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20134                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20135                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20136                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20137                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20138                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20139                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20140                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20141                                  ;								      ;I070
 20142                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20143                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20144                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20145                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20146                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20147                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 20148                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 20149                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 20150                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 20151                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20152                                  ;								      ;I070
 20153                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20154                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070

 21184                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21185                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21186                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21187                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21188                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21189                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21190                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21191                                  ;
 21192                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21193                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21194                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21195                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21196                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21197                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21198                                  ;
 21199                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21200                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21201                                  ;
 21202                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21203                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21204                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21205                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21206                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21207                                  ;
 21208                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21209                                  ;
 21210                                  ;			  none.
 21211                                  
 21212                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21213                                  ;
 21214                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21215                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21216                                  
 21217                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21218                                  
 21219 00000F3C 50                      	push	ax

 21221 00000F3E 52                      	push	dx

 21421                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21422                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21423                                  ;
 21424                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21425                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21426                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21427                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21428                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21429                                  ; program).
 21430                                  
 21431                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21432                                  
 21433                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21434                                  
 21435 00001024 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21436                                  
 21437                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21438                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21439                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21440                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21441                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21442                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21443                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21444                                  ; carridge return.
 21445                                  
 21446                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21447                                  ;character after =.
 21448

 21450 00001026 1E                      	push	ds
 21451 00001027 07                      	pop	es

 21453 00001029 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21454                                  
 21455 0000102B 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21456 0000102D FC                      	cld
 21457 0000102E 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21458 00001034 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21459                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21460 00001037 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21461 00001038 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21462 0000103A 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 21463 0000103C EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21464                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21465 0000103E AC                      	lodsb
 21466 0000103F 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21467 00001042 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21468 00001044 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21469 00001046 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21470 00001048 47                      	inc	di
 21471 00001049 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21472                                  done_installparm:
 21473 0000104B 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21474 00001050 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21475 00001053 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 21476 00001055 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 21477                                  					; starts with cr.

 21567                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21568                                  
 21569                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21570                                  ;
 21571                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21572                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21573                                  ;
 21574                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21575                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21576                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21577                                  
 21578                                  ParaRound:
 21579 000010A4 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21580 000010A7 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21581 000010A9 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21582 000010AB D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21583 000010AD D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21584 000010AF C3                      	retn
 21585                                  
 21586                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21587                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21588                                  ;
 21589                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21590                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21591                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21592                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21593                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21594                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21595                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21596                                  ;
 21597                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21598                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21599                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21600                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21601                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21602                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21603                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21604                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21605                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21606                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21607                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21608                                  ;
 21609                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21610                                  
 21611                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21612                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21613                                  sysinit_base:				
 21614 000010B0 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21615 000010B5 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21616 000010BA CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21617 000010BC 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21618 000010C1 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21619 000010C6 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21620 000010C7 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21621 000010C8 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21622                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21623                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21624 000010CA E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21625 000010CD 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21626 000010D2 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21627                                  
 21628                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21629                                  
 21630 000010D4 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21631 000010D6 0E                      	push	cs
 21632 000010D7 1F                      	pop	ds
 21633 000010D8 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21634 000010DB CD21                    	int	21h
 21635                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21636                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21637                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21638                                  _stall: 
 21639                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21640 000010DD F4                      	hlt 
 21641                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21642                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21643 000010DE EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21644                                  
 21645                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21646 000010E0 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21647                                  
 21648                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21649                                  
 21650                                  sum_up:
 21651                                  
 21652                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21653                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21654                                  ;
 21655                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21656                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21657                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21658                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21659                                  ;
 21660                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21661                                  
 21662 000010E5 1E                      	push	ds
 21663                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21664                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21665 000010E6 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21666 000010EA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21667 000010EC 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21668 000010EE 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21669 000010F0 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21670                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21671 000010F5 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21672 000010F7 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21673                                  sum1:
 21674 000010F9 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21675 000010FB 46                      	inc	si
 21676 000010FC 46                      	inc	si
 21677 000010FD E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21678                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21679                                  sum_sys_code:
 21680                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21681 000010FF BEFE10                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21682                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21683                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21684                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21685                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21686                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21687                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21688                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21689 00001102 B9[F037]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21690 00001105 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21691 00001107 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21692                                  sum2:
 21693 00001109 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21694 0000110C 46                      	inc	si
 21695 0000110D 46                      	inc	si

 21721                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21722                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21723                                  ;
 21724                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21725                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21726                                  ;
 21727                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21728                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21729                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21730                                  ;
 21731                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21732                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21733                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21734                                  
 21735                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)

 21776 00001164 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no

 21779 0000116A 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21780                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0

 21783 00001173 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax

 21786 0000117A 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21787                                  set_buff_2:
 21788 0000117D 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax

 21790 00001182 2E800E[1014]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 21791                                  	;call	round

 21794 00001188 E9851E                  	jmp	round

 21796                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21797                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21798                                  ;
 21799                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21800                                  ;
 21801                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21802                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21803                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21804                                  
 21805                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21806                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21807 0000118B 53                      	push	bx
 21808 0000118C 52                      	push	dx
 21809 0000118D 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21810 00001191 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21811                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21812 00001196 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21813                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21814                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21815                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21816 00001199 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21817 0000119B 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21818 0000119D B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21819                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21820 000011A0 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21821 000011A2 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21822 000011A5 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 21823                                  
 21824                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21825                                  	; 05/09/2023
 21826                                  	; zf=1
 21827 000011A7 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 21828                                  	; zf=1
 21829                                  
 21830                                  	;zf=1
 21831                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21832                                  	;zf=1
 21833 000011A8 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21834                                  got_hma:
 21835 000011AD 5A                      	pop	dx
 21836 000011AE 5B                      	pop	bx
 21837 000011AF C3                      	retn

 21862 000011CB 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0

 21867                                  ; ======================================================================
 21868                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21869                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21870                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21871                                  
 21872                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21873                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21874                                  ;
 21875                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21876                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21877                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21878                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21879                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21880                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21881                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21882                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21883                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21884                                  ;
 21885                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21886                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21887                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21888                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21889                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21890                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21891                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21892                                  ;	conditions:
 21893                                  ;
 21894                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21895                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21896                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21897                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21898                                  ;
 21899                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21900                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21901                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21902                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21903                                  ;
 21904                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21905                                  ;
 21906                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21907                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21908                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21909                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21910                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21911                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21912                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21913                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21914                                  ;
 21915                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21916                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21917                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21918                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21919                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21920                                  ;
 21921                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21922                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21923                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21924                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21925                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21926                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21927                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21928                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21929                                  ;
 21930                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21931                                  
 21932                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21933                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21934                                  
 21935                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21936                                  stackinit:
 21937 000011D8 50                      	push	ax
 21938 000011D9 1E                      	push	ds
 21939 000011DA 06                      	push	es
 21940 000011DB 53                      	push	bx
 21941 000011DC 51                      	push	cx
 21942 000011DD 52                      	push	dx
 21943 000011DE 57                      	push	di
 21944 000011DF 56                      	push	si
 21945 000011E0 55                      	push	bp
 21946                                  
 21947                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21948                                  
 21949                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21950                                  	; ds = cs
 21951 000011E1 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21952 000011E4 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21953                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21954                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21955                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21956 000011E6 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area

 22000 00001221 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax

 22751 000013AF 817F064B42              	cmp	word [bx+6],424Bh
 22752 000013B4 7411                    	je	short int_xx_not_first
 22753                                  	
 22754 000013B6 81FA00F0                	cmp	dx,0F000h
 22755 000013BA 750B                    	jne	short int_xx_not_first
 22756                                  
 22757 000013BC 06                      	push	es
 22758                                  	;push	dx
 22759                                  	;mov	dx,0F000h
 22760 000013BD 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 22761 000013BF 263B1E01FF              	cmp	bx,[es:0FF01h]
 22762                                        	;pop	dx
 22763 000013C4 07                      	pop	es
 22764 000013C5 7401                    	je	short int_xx_first
 22765                                  
 22766                                  int_xx_not_first:
 22767 000013C7 F9                      	stc
 22768                                  int_xx_first:
 22769 000013C8 1F                      	pop	ds
 22770 000013C9 C3                      	retn
 22771                                  
 22772                                  ;%endif
 22773                                  
 22774                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22775                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22776                                  
 22777                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22778                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22779                                  
 22780                                  new_init_loop:
 22781                                  
 22782                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22783                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22784                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22785                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22786                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22787                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22788                                  
 22789 000013CA 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22790 000013CD 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22791 000013CF 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22792 000013D3 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22793                                  
 22794 000013D6 1E                      	push	ds
 22795                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22796                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22797                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22798 000013D7 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22799 000013DA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22800 000013DC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22801 000013DF 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22802 000013E1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22803 000013E5 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 22804 000013E8 1F                      	pop	ds
 22805                                  
 22806 000013E9 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22807 000013EC 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22808 000013F0 C3                      	retn
 22809                                  
 22810                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22811                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22812                                  
 22813                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22814                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22815                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22816                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22817                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22818                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22819                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22820                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.

 22831

 22833                                  	;push	es
 22834                                  	;push	cx
 22835                                  
 22836 000013F1 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22837 000013F6 2E890E[0E14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22838 000013FB 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22839                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22840                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22841 000013FD 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22842 00001401 41                      	inc	cx
 22843                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22844 00001402 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22845                                  
 22846                                  	; 04/09/2023
 22847                                  	;pop	cx
 22848                                  	;pop	es
 22849                                  	
 22850 00001407 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22851 0000140C C3                      	retn

 23054                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23055                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23056                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23057                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="

 23064                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23065 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX

 23067 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23068                                  endstruc

 23088                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23089                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23090 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23091 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23092 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23093                                  endstruc
 23094                                  
 23095                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23096                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23097                                  ;
 23098                                  ;
 23099                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23100                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23101                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23102                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23103                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23104                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23105                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23106                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23107                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23108                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23109                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23110                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23111                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23112                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23113                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23114                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23115                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23116                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23117                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23118                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23119                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23120                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23121                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23122                                  ;	   :
 23123                                  ;
 23124                                  ;Note:
 23125                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23126                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23127                                  ;
 23128                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23129                                  ;
 23130                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23131                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23132                                  ;
 23133                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23134                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23135                                  ;
 23136                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23137                                  ;
 23138                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23139                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23140                                  ;
 23141                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23142                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23143                                  ;
 23144                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23145                                  ;
 23146                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23147                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23148                                  ;
 23149                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23150                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23151                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23152                                  ;
 23153                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23154                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23155                                  ;
 23156                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23157                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23158                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23159                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23160                                  
 23161                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23162                                  
 23163                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23164                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23165                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23166                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23167                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23168                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23169                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23170                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23171                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23172                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23173                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23174                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23175                                  
 23176                                  ;**** Function flags
 23177                                  
 23178                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23179                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23180                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23181                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23182                                  
 23183                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23184                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23185 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23186 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23187 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23188 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23189 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23190 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23191                                  endstruc
 23192                                  
 23193                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23194                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23195                                  ;
 23196                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23197                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23198                                  ;	     +-
 23199                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23200                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23201                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23202                                  ;	     |	:
 23203                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23204                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23205                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23206                                  ;	     |	:
 23207                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23208                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23209                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23210                                  ;	     +-	:
 23211                                  ;
 23212                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23213                                  ;
 23214                                  ;Note:
 23215                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23216                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23217                                  ;
 23218                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23219                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23220                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23221                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23222                                  
 23223                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23224                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23225                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23226                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23227                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23228                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23229                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23230                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23231                                  
 23232                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23233 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23234 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23235 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23236 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23237 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23238                                  endstruc
 23239                                  
 23240                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23241                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23242                                  ;
 23243                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23244                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23245                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23246                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23247                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23248                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23249                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23250                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23251                                  ;
 23252                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23253                                  ;
 23254                                  ;            +-
 23255                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23256                                  ;	    | or
 23257                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23258                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23259                                  ;	    | or
 23260                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23261                                  ;	    | or
 23262                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23263                                  ;	    | or
 23264                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23265                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23266                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23267                                  ;	    | or
 23268                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23269                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23270                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23271                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23272                                  ;	    +-
 23273                                  ;
 23274                                  ;
 23275                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23276                                  ;      list.
 23277                                  ;
 23278                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23279                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23280                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23281                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23282                                  
 23283                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure

 23286 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23287 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23288 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23289                                  endstruc

 23319                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23320                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line
