 23404                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23405                                  ; SysParse;
 23406                                  ;
 23407                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23408                                  ;
 23409                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23410                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23411                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23412                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23413                                  ;
 23414                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23415                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23416                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23417                                  ;
 23418                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23419                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23420                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23421                                  ;
 23422                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23423                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23424                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23425                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23426                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23427                                  ;
 23428                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23429                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23430                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23431                                  ;
 23432                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23433                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23434                                  ;
 23435                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23436                                  ;
 23437                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23438                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23439                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23440                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23441                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23442                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23443                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23444                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23445                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23446                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23447                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23448                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23449                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23450                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23451                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23452                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23453                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23454                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23455                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23456                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23457                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23458                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23459                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23460                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23461                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23462                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23463                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23464                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23465                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23466                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23467                                  
 23468                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23469                                  
 23470                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23471                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23472                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23473                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23474                                  
 23475                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23476                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23477                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23478                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23479                                  ;
 23480                                  
 23481                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23482                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23483                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23484                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23485                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23486                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23487                                  
 23488                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23489                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23490                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23491                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23492                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23493                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23494                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23495                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23496                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23497                                  
 23498                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23499                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23500                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23501                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23502                                  ;	     segment.
 23503

 23505                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 23506                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020

 24101                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24102                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24103                                  ;
 24104                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24105                                  ;
 24106                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24107                                  ;	    AL = type
 24108                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24109                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24110                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24111                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24112                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24113                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24114                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24115                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24116                                  ;
 24117                                  ; Output:   None
 24118                                  ;
 24119                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24120                                  ;
 24121                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24122                                  ;***********************************************************************

 24517                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24518                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24519                                  ;
 24520                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24521                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24522                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24523                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling

 24535                                  
 24536                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24537                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24538                                  
 24539                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here

 24542 00001883 2E8026[2314]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value

 24549

 24551                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;

 25508                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25509                                  ;
 25510                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25511                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25512                                  ;
 25513                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25514                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25515                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25516                                  ;
 25517                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25518                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25519                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25520                                  
 25521                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25522                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25523                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25524                                  ;
 25525                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25526                                  
 25527                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25528                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25529                                  
 25530                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25531                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25532                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25533                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25534 00001C15 BD[2C14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25535                                  
 25536                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25537 00001C18 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25538 00001C1A 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25539                                  
 25540                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25541 00001C1C 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25542 00001C1E 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25543                                  
 25544 00001C20 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25545                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25546                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25547 00001C21 C3                      	retn
 25548                                  
 25549                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25550                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25551                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25552                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25553                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25554                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25555                                  
 25556                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25557                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25558 00001C22 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25559 00001C24 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25560                                  
 25561 00001C26 2E800E[2314]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25562                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25563                                  
 25564                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25565                                  	; cf=0
 25566                                  	;retn
 25567                                  
 25568                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25569                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25570                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25571 00001C2C F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25572                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25573                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25574 00001C2D C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25575                                  
 25576                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25577                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25578                                  ;
 25579                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25580                                  ;
 25581                                  ;  Input:
 25582                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25583                                  ;
 25584                                  ;  Output:
 25585                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25586                                  ;
 25587                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25588                                  ;
 25589                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25590                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25591                                  
 25592                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25593 00001C2E 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25594 00001C2F 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25595 00001C30 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25596                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25597                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25598                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25599 00001C31 2E8B36[2014]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 25600 00001C36 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 25601 00001C38 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 25602 00001C3A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25603 00001C3B 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25604 00001C3C 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25605 00001C3D 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25606 00001C3E 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25607 00001C3F 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25608 00001C40 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25609                                  	; si = 0 ; 14/08/2023
 25610                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25611 00001C41 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 25612 00001C43 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25613 00001C46 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25614                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25615 00001C48 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25616 00001C4A 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25617 00001C4C 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25618 00001C4D 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25619 00001C4E 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25620 00001C4F 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25621 00001C50 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25622 00001C51 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25623 00001C52 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25624 00001C53 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25625                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25626 00001C55 2E8936[1E14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25627 00001C5A 2E891E[2014]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25628                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25629                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25630                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25631                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25632 00001C5F 2EC536[1E14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25633                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25634 00001C64 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25635 00001C67 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25636 00001C69 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25637 00001C6B 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25638 00001C6D 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25639 00001C70 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25640 00001C72 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25641 00001C73 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25642                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25643 00001C75 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25644 00001C76 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25645                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25646 00001C77 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25647                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25648                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25649                                  	; cf=0
 25650                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25651                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25652 00001C79 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25653 00001C7A 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25654 00001C7B 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25655 00001C7C C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26209                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 26210                                  
 26211                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26212                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26213                                  
 26214                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26215                                  ;
 26216                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26217                                  ;
 26218                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26219                                  ;
 26220                                  ;   Modification log:
 26221                                  ;
 26222                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26223                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26224                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26225                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26226                                  ;
 26227                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26228                                  ;
 26229                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26230                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26231                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26232                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26233                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26234                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26235                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26236                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26237                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26238                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26239                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26240                                  ;
 26241                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26242                                  
 26243                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26244                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26245                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26246                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26247                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26248                                  
 26249                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26250                                  
 26251                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26252                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26253                                  
 26254                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26255                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26256                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26257                                  
 26258                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26259                                  ;
 26260                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26261                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26262                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26263                                  ;	           line.
 26264                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26265                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26266                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26267                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26268                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26269                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26270                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26271                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26272                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26273                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26274                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26275                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26276                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26277                                  ;	           for details).
 26278                                  
 26279                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 26280                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 26281                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 26282                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 26283                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26284                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26285                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 26286                                  fm_strat: db	0
 26287                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 26288                                  
 26289                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26290                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26291                                  
 26292                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26293                                  
 26294                                  %endif
 26295                                  
 26296                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****

 26305                                  
 26306 00001E60 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 26307 00001E62 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26308 00001E64 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26309 00001E66 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26310 00001E6A 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26311                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 26312                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 26313                                  ;

 26315 00001E6F 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 26316 00001E71 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 26317 00001E73 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)

 26343                                  
 26344                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26345                                  
 26346                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26347                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 26348                                  
 26349                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26350                                  ;
 26351                                  ; procedure : doconf
 26352                                  ;
 26353                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 26354                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 26355                                  ;
 26356                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26357                                  
 26358                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26359                                  doconf:
 26360 00001E93 0E                      	push	cs
 26361 00001E94 1F                      	pop	ds
 26362                                  
 26363 00001E95 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 26364                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 26365 00001E98 CD21                    	int	21h
 26366 00001E9A 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 26367                                  
 26368                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26369                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26370                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 26371                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 26372                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26373                                  
 26374 00001E9E BA[0333]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 26375 00001EA1 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 26376                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 26377 00001EA4 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 26378 00001EA5 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 26379 00001EA7 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 26380                                  
 26381                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26382                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26383                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 26384                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 26385                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 26386 00001EA9 C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 26387 00001EAE C3                      	retn
 26388                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 26389 00001EAF 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 26390 00001EB1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26391 00001EB3 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26392                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 26393 00001EB5 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 26394 00001EB8 CD21                    	int	21h
 26395 00001EBA A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 26396                                  
 26397 00001EBD 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26398                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 26399 00001EBF B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 26400 00001EC2 CD21                    	int	21h
 26401                                  
 26402                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 26403                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26404 00001EC4 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 26405                                  
 26406 00001EC8 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 26407 00001ECB A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 26408 00001ECE E8D3F1                  	call	ParaRound
 26409 00001ED1 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 26410                                  
 26411                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26412                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26413                                  ;;
 26414                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26415                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26416                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26417                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26418                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26419                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26420                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26421                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 26422                                  ;;
 26423                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 26424                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 26425                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 26426                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26427                                  
 26428 00001ED3 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 26429                                  	
 26430                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 26431                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 26432                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26433 00001ED6 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 26434 00001EDA E8E8EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 26435                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26436                                  	; ds <> cs 
 26437 00001EDD 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 26438

 26557                                  ;   number immediately following it....

 26564                                  
 26565                                          push    ax                      ;
 26566                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26567                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26568                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26569                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26570                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26571                                          pop     ax
 26572                                  ;
 26573                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26574                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26575                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26576                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26577                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26578                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26579                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26580                                  ;   spot.
 26581                                  ;
 26582                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26583                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26584                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26585                                  ;   retrieved.
 26586                                  ;
 26587                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?

 26596                                  not_final:                              ;
 26597                                  ;endif

 26724                                  
 26725                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 26726                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 26727                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 26728                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 26729

 26733

 26735                                  
 26736                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 26737                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 26738                                          int     21h

 26741                                          int     21h
 26742                                  
 26743                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 26744                                  
 26745                                  %endif

 26767                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26768                                  ;									      *
 26769                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26770                                  ;									      *
 26771                                  ; input :								      *
 26772                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26773                                  ; output:								      *
 26774                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26775                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26776                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26777                                  ;									      *
 26778                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26779                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26780                                  ; logic:								      *
 26781                                  ; {									      *
 26782                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26783                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26784                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26785                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26786                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26787                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26788                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26789                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26790                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26791                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26792                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26793                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26794                                  ;	};								      *
 26795                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26796                                  ; };									      *
 26797                                  ;									      *
 26798                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26799                                  
 26800                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26801                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 26802                                  tryb:
 26803 00001FCC 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 26804 00001FCF 7557                    	jne	short tryc
 26805                                  
 26806                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26807                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26808                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26809                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26810                                  ;;endif
 26811                                  
 26812                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26813                                  	; 18/12/2022
 26814 00001FD1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26815                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 26816 00001FD3 880E[C41C]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 26817                                  
 26818 00001FD7 BF[7D1C]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 26819                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 26820                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26821                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 26822                                  do7:
 26823 00001FDA E87506                  	call	sysinit_parse
 26824 00001FDD 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 26825                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26826                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 26827                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 26828                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26829                                  ;sr7:
 26830                                  	;jmp	coff
 26831                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26832 00001FDF E9EE05                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 26833                                  if7:
 26834 00001FE2 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?

 26836                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 26837 00001FE7 813E[C81C][BD1C]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x

 26871

 26886                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26887                                  ; break command
 26888                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26889                                  
 26890                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26891                                  ;									    *
 26892                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 26893                                  ;									    *
 26894                                  ; input :								    *
 26895                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 26896                                  ; output:								    *
 26897                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 26898                                  ;									    *
 26899                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 26900                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 26901                                  ; logic:								    *
 26902                                  ; {									    *
 26903                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 26904                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 26905                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 26906                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 26907                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 26908                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 26909                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 26910                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 26911                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 26912                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 26913                                  ;	};								    *
 26914                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 26915                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *

 26972                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26973                                  ; multitrack command
 26974                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26975                                  
 26976                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26977                                  ;									      *
 26978                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 26979                                  ;									      *
 26980                                  ; input :								      *
 26981                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26982                                  ; output:								      *
 26983                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 26984                                  ;									      *
 26985                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26986                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26987                                  ; logic:								      *
 26988                                  ; {									      *
 26989                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 26990                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26991                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26992                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26993                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26994                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 26995                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 26996                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 26997                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *
 26998                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				      *
 26999                                  ;	};								      *
 27000                                  ;	if (no error) then						      *
 27001                                  ;	   dos function call to set multrk_flag according to p_mtrk.	      *

 27003                                  ; };									      *
 27004                                  ;									      *

 28310                                  trypbad:
 28311 000024B7 E9B701                  	jmp	badop
 28312                                  
 28313                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28314                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28315                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28316                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28317                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28318                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28319                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28320                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28321                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28322                                  
 28323                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28324                                  ;									  *
 28325                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28326                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28327                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28328                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 28329                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 28330                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 28331                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 28332                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 28333                                  ; input :								  *
 28334                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 28335                                  ; output:								  *
 28336                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 28337                                  ;									  *
 28338                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 28339                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 28340                                  ; logic:								  *
 28341                                  ; {									  *
 28342                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 28343                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 28344                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 28345                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 28346                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28347                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28348                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28349                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28350                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28351                                  ;	     }								  *
 28352                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 28353                                  ;	     error exit;						  *

 28791                                  ;***********************************************************************
 28792                                  ;								       *
 28793                                  ; function: parse the option switches specified.		       *

 28795                                  ; when we need to set system data flag,use this command.	       *
 28796                                  ;								       *
 28797                                  ; input :							       *
 28798                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.			       *

 29043                                  ;	 procedure.

 29389                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29390                                  ;
 29391                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29392                                  ;
 29393                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29394                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29395                                  ;
 29396                                  ;	Output : none
 29397                                  ;
 29398                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 29399                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29400                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29401                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29402                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29403                                  ;
 29404                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29405                                  
 29406                                  LieInt12Mem:
 29407                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29408                                  	; ds = cs
 29409 000026F7 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 29410                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 29411                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 29412 000026FA E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 29413 000026FD 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29414                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29415                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29416                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 29417                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 29418                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29419                                  	; ds = cs
 29420 000026FF 803E[7D1E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 29421 00002704 74F0                    	je	short limx
 29422 00002706 A1[641E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 29423                                  lim_set:
 29424                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29425                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29426                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 29427                                  ;limx:
 29428                                  	;retn
 29429                                  	
 29430                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 29431                                  
 29432                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29433                                  ;
 29434                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29435                                  ;
 29436                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29437                                  ;	Output : none
 29438                                  ;
 29439                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29440                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29441                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29442                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29443                                  ;
 29444                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29445                                  
 29446                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29447                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29448 00002709 1E                      	push	ds
 29449 0000270A BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29450 0000270D 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29451 0000270F 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29452 00002713 2E891E[811E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29453 00002718 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29454 0000271A D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29455 0000271C A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29456 0000271F 2EC606[801E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29457 00002725 1F                      	pop	ds
 29458                                  ;limx:
 29459 00002726 C3                      	retn
 29460                                  
 29461                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29462                                  ;
 29463                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29464                                  ;
 29465                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29466                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29467                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29468                                  ;
 29469                                  ;	Output : none
 29470                                  ;
 29471                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29472                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29473                                  ;
 29474                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29475                                  
 29476                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29477                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29478                                  	; ds = cs
 29479 00002727 803E[801E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29480                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29481                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29482                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29483 0000272C 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29484                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29485 0000272E B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29486 00002731 8826[801E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29487                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29488                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29489 00002735 1E                      	push	ds
 29490                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29491 00002736 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29492 00002738 2EA1[811E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29493 0000273C A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 29494 0000273F 1F                      	pop	ds
 29495                                  timx:
 29496 00002740 C3                      	retn
 29497                                  
 29498                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29499                                  ;
 29500                                  ; procedure : IsIt3Com?
 29501                                  ;
 29502                                  ;	Input : DevEntry = Seg:0 of device driver
 29503                                  ;	Output : Zero flag set if device name is 'PROTMAN$'
 29504                                  ;		 else Zero flag is reset
 29505                                  ;
 29506                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29507                                  
 29508                                  IsIt3Com:
 29509                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29510                                  	; ds = cs
 29511 00002741 1E                      	push	ds
 29512 00002742 06                      	push	es
 29513 00002743 56                      	push	si
 29514                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29515 00002744 C536[661E]              	lds	si,[DevEntry]
 29516                                  	;lds	si,[cs:DevEntry]	; ptr to device header
 29517 00002748 83C60A                  	add	si,SYSDEV.NAME ; 10 	; ptr device name
 29518 0000274B 0E                      	push	cs
 29519 0000274C 07                      	pop	es
 29520 0000274D BF[831E]                	mov	di,ThreeComName
 29521 00002750 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; name length
 29522 00002753 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 29523 00002755 5E                      	pop	si
 29524 00002756 07                      	pop	es
 29525 00002757 1F                      	pop	ds
 29526 00002758 C3                      	retn
 29527

 29535 0000275E 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx
 29536 00002760 2E8B1E[A302]            	mov	bx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]
 29537                                  	;mov	[2],bx
 29538 00002765 891E0200                	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],bx
 29539 00002769 1F                      	pop	ds
 29540 0000276A C3                      	retn

 29545                                  
 29546                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29547                                  
 29548                                  %if 0
 29549                                  
 29550                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29551                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29552                                  
 29553                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29554                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29555                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29556                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29557                                  
 29558                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29559                                  ;
 29560                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29561                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29562                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29563                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29564                                  ;
 29565                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29566                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29567                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29568                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29569                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29570                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29571                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29572                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29573                                  ; available during the load.
 29574                                  ;
 29575                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29576                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29577                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29578                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29579                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29580                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29581                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29582                                  ;
 29583                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29584                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29585                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29586                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29587                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29588                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29589                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29590                                  ;
 29591                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29592                                  
 29593                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29594                                  
 29595                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29596                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29597                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29598                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29599                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29600                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29601                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29602                                  
 29603                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29604                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29605                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29606                                  
 29607                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29608                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29609                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29610                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29611                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29612                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29613                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29614                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29615                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29616                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29617                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29618                                  
 29619                                  InitVar:
 29620                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29621                                  	push	ax
 29622                                  	push	cx
 29623                                  	push	di
 29624                                  	push	es
 29625                                  
 29626                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29627                                  	push	cs
 29628                                  	pop	es
 29629                                  
 29630                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29631                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29632                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29633                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29634                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29635                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29636                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29637                                  
 29638                                  	cld
 29639                                  
 29640                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29641                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29642                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29643                                  
 29644                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29645                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29646                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29647                                  
 29648                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29649                                  
 29650                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29651                                  	pop	es
 29652                                  	pop	di
 29653                                  	pop	cx
 29654                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29655                                  
 29656                                  	retn
 29657                                  
 29658                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29659                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29660                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29661                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29662                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29663                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29664                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29665                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29666                                  
 29667                                  FixMem:
 29668                                  	push	ax
 29669                                  	push	bx
 29670                                  	push	cx
 29671                                  	push	dx
 29672                                  	push	es
 29673                                  
 29674                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29675                                  
 29676                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29677                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29678                                  
 29679                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29680                                  
 29681                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29682                                  
 29683                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29684                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29685                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29686                                  
 29687                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29688                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29689                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29690                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29691                                  
 29692                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29693                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29694                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29695                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29696                                  
 29697                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29698                                  
 29699                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29700                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29701                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29702                                  
 29703                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29704                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29705                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29706                                  	inc	bx
 29707                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29708                                  
 29709                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29710                                  
 29711                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29712                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29713                                  
 29714                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29715                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29716                                  	inc	bx
 29717                                  	mov	es,bx
 29718                                  
 29719                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29720                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29721                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29722                                  fmX:	
 29723                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29724                                  
 29725                                  	pop	es
 29726                                  	pop	dx
 29727                                  	pop	cx
 29728                                  	pop	bx
 29729                                  	pop	ax
 29730                                  
 29731                                  	retn
 29732                                  
 29733                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29734                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29735                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29736                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29737                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29738                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29739                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29740                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29741                                  
 29742                                  fm_link:
 29743                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29744                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29745                                  
 29746                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29747                                  	;
 29748                                  	;push	es
 29749                                  	;push	cs
 29750                                  	;pop	es
 29751                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29752                                  	;pop	es
